0.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses
0.description: Restricts the installation, concealment, placement or use of an electronic tracking device in or on a motor vehicle, and adds electronic tracking devices to the definition of "domestic violence" under state law.

1.title: The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act Of 2016
1.description: Creates "The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act of 2016" which would exempt from liability and provide immunity for violations of probation and/or parole to any person who administers an opioid antagonist to another person to prevent a drug overdose.

2.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2.title: Relating To Probate Practice And Procedure-peter Falk Bill
2.description: Provides that unless a limited guardian, guardian or conservator is specifically authorized by court order, the limited guardian, guardian or conservator may not restrict the personal rights of the ward.

3.title: Causes Of Action
3.description: Creates a cause of action for employees who are discharged or otherwise sanctioned by an employer on account of being required to attend court or other hearing.

4.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers
4.description: Prohibits electric distribution companies from charging an interconnecting renewable energy customer for upgrades that can be funded through rates assessed pursuant to an electric infrastructure, safety and reliability plan.

5.title: Licensing Of Massage Therapists
5.description: Enables any city or town by ordinance to regulate the opening, the presence, the location, and operation of any body works business or any business providing body works services, within the municipality.

6.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
6.title: Sidewalks
6.description: Requires the director of the department of transportation to complete snow removal on state sidewalks and walkways within twenty-four (24) hours after the end of a snowstorm.

7.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
7.title: Get On Your Feet Loan Forgiveness Program
7.description: Establishes "The Get On Your Feet Loan Forgiveness Program" in Rhode Island, to assist recent college and university graduates in the repayment of their student loans, by providing a grace period for the first 2 years after graduation.

8.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
8.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Computation
8.description: Provides a sales/use tax holiday on August 6, 2016, only subject to renewal/continuation by the general assembly for future years thereafter.

9.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Special Plate For Rocky Point Foundation
9.description: Authorizes a special license plate for the Rocky Point Foundation, Inc., and specifies the fees and other conditions for issuance.

10.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Providence City Council
10.description: Authorizes the division of motor vehicles to issue special license plates to members of the Providence city council.

11.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
11.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Brown University Professors
11.description: Repeals the exemption from taxation of property belonging to Brown University professors.

12.title: Public Utilities Commission--information Accessibility Service For Persons With Disabilities
12.description: Includes wireless telephones in the adaptive telephone equipment loan program that services the needs of persons who are deaf, hard-of-hearing, severely speech impaired, or those with neuromuscular impairments.

13.title: Relating To Alcoholic Beverages-retail Licenses-town Of Lincoln
13.description: Permits the town of Lincoln to grant a proposed Class B liquor license within two hundred feet (200') of a church.

14.title: Retail Licenses--town Of East Greenwich
14.description: Authorizes the town of East Greenwich to exempt from the restriction on liquor licenses within two hundred feet (200') of a school or place of worship any proposed Class B or C license located in a Commercial CD-1 zone.

15.title: Relating To Animals And Animal Husbandry
15.description: Permits the town of Foster to provide, by ordinance, an annual or biennial licensing fee of fifteen dollars for all dogs.

16.title: Relating To Solemnization Of Marriages
16.description: Allows Hanna Strowman to join Wendy Shaffer and Howard Rappoport in marriage on or about April 2, 2016, within the City of Warwick, Rhode Island.

20.title: Registrations Of Voters
20.description: Requires the secretary of state to establish a system to provide for the electronic registration of voters and limits the use or transfer of the information supplied by the registering voter.

21.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure-identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
21.description: Clarifies the provisions of §12-19-19 and make those persons who complete a deferred sentence agreement immediately eligible for expungement of all arrest records if they have complied with all terms and conditions of the deferred sentence agreement.

22.title: Relating To Alcoholic Beverages
22.description: Makes the possession, purchase, or sale of powdered alcohol a crime punishable by a fine not to exceed one thousand dollars ($1,000).

23.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
23.title: Pawnbrokers Liability For Selling Stolen Goods
23.description: Requires pawnshops refund the purchase price and interest to a buyer who finds the property purchased from the shop to be stolen. Also provides for criminal action against the owner.

24.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
24.title: Expired Debt Act
24.description: Prohibits debt collection practices for debt which is beyond the statute of limitations for filing a legal action for collection.

25.title: Adoption Of Children
25.description: Permits a petition for adoption, and if necessary, termination of parental rights, to be filed by a grandparent(s) without the noncustodial parents' consent, when the child is in the sole custody of the grandparent(s).

26.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
26.title: Lobbyist Political Contributions
26.description: Prohibits lobbyists from making any political contributions to any member of the general assembly from January 1 through July 1 in any year.

27.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
27.title: Accidents And Accident Reports
27.description: Increases the penalties and fines for the various motor vehicle offenses involving leaving the scene of an accident.

28.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
28.title: Motor Vehicle Offenses
28.description: Increases the penalties for driving so as to endanger, resulting in death, to up to 20 years' incarceration and provides for a license suspension for up to 10 years.

29.title: National Criminal Records Check
29.description: Allows the department of children, youth and families to process nationwide criminal record checks.

30.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
30.title: Publication Of Municipal And Other Public Budgets In Digital Form
30.description: Makes public entity budgets available in digital form through the secretary of state.

31.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
31.title: Relating To Elections-nomination Of Party And Independent Candidates-city Of Woonsocket
31.description: Provides that nomination papers for certain candidates for citywide nonpartisan office in the city of Woonsocket would require at least one hundred (100) signatures.

32.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
32.title: Uniform Child Custody Jurisdiction And Enforcement Act
32.description: Requires that custodial parents give non-custodial parents notice of intentions to apply for at-home schooling. It would also allow appeals of certain school committee decisions about home schooling to the family court.

33.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
33.title: Courts - District Court
33.description: Grant district courts and certain municipal courts created by §8-8-3(a)(4) the power to issue restraining orders and permanent injunctions in housing matters, and would include the power to order a building into receivership.

34.title: Nonregulated Power Producer Consumer Bill Of Rights
34.description: Imposes a series of regulatory requirements upon the electrical generation and distribution industry for the protection of consumers.

35.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
35.title: Public Utilities Commission
35.description: Requires all public utilities to maintain a customer service facility within the state to perform services such as addressing customer inquiries and accepting bill payments.

36.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Imprint, Inc.
36.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Imprint, Inc.

37.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Executives Association Of Rhode Island, Inc.
37.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Executives Association Of Rhode Island, Inc.

38.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Miceli Construction & Roofing, Inc
38.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Miceli Construction & Roofing, Inc

39.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
39.title: Regulatory Powers Of Administration
39.description: Limits increases in rates electric distribution companies may impose without general assembly approval.

40.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
40.title: Hearing Aid Dealers And Fitters
40.description: Prohibits the sale and/or delivery of hearing aids directly to consumer through internet or direct mail, and provides for criminal penalties.

41.title: Electricians
41.description: Includes maintenance of certain electrical components within the law governing the licensing of electricians.

42.title: Quonset Development Corporation
42.description: Grants the Quonset Development Corporation the authority to purchase and obtain water supply and water service from any city, town, water district, or other water supply authority.

43.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
43.title: Career And Technical Education
43.description: Permits students with necessary educational background to participate in career and technical internships.

44.title: Relating To Education
44.description: Appropriate public education made available to a disabled child until their twenty-first birthday or completion of program in which they are enrolled as of their twenty-first birthday.

45.title: Establishment Of Charter Public Schools
45.description: Requires local support in form of ordinance for proposed charter schools and requires council on elementary or secondary education to place weight on impact of sending districts when considering proposed charter or expansion of charter schools.

47.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
47.title: Rhode Island Vision Education And Services Program
47.description: Makes findings about and establishes a definition of dyslexia.

48.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
48.title: Screening For Reading Disabilities
48.description: Requires school districts to conduct screening for dyslexia and other reading disabilities of school children who have exhibited one or more potential indicators using certain screening methods selected by the commissioner of education.

49.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
49.title: Professional Development
49.description: Provides for professional development opportunities relating to reading disabilities and would require two (2) hours of professional development instruction pertaining to reading disabilities for certain general education teachers and specialists.

50.title: School Committees And Superintendents
50.description: Directs school superintendents to review discipline data to determine unequal impact on students based on race/ethnicity/disability status and respond to any disparity and sets out of school supervision standards.

53.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
53.title: Commission On Standards And Training
53.description: Require mandatory training standards for police officers and trainees, in identifying, responding, and handling all incidents involving any person with a developmental disability.

55.title: Dogs
55.description: Requires that the sheltering and nourishment of dogs conform to the industry standards established by the Tufts Animal Care and Conditions Scale regarding outside sheltering, proper nourishment, sanitary conditions, and physical condition.

57.title: Relating To Food And Drugs-regulation Of Powdered Caffeine
57.description: Prohibits the sale of powdered caffeine to any person under the age of twenty-one (21) years of age. Penalties include fines and/or imprisonment for suppliers, and fines and counseling for those found in possession.

58.title: In Amendment Of Chapter 3235 Of The 1953 Public Laws Entitled "pertaining To Municipal Primaries And Elections In The City Of Woonsocket, State Of Rhode Island, And Also Validating Certain Provisions In City Of Woonsocket, Rhode Island Home Rule Charter," As Amended
58.description: Amends and repeals certain provisions of Chapter 3235 of the 1953 Public Laws pertaining to elections in the City of Woonsocket.

59.title: Animal Care
59.description: Requires that municipal animal control officers be certified by the National Animal Care & Control Association.

60.title: Charter Schools
60.description: Requires the board of education to make certain findings regarding the sending districts before granting approval to a new charter school project.

61.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

61.description: Eliminates a city or town's financial obligations to pay for their students enrollment in charter schools..

63.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
63.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability And Computation - Lease Payments
63.description: Prohibits the collection of a sales or use tax on that portion of a motor vehicle lease payment representing taxes payable by the lessor on the leased motor vehicle.

64.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
64.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers-green Energy Revolving Fund
64.description: Establishes the green energy revolving fund for the purpose of providing loans for green energy projects.

65.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

65.description: Implement the provisions of the Lean government initiative, which has been adopted in the private business community and governments throughout the country, to eliminate waste and inefficiency in the operation of government.

66.description: Requires RI DOT to report annually to the general assembly regarding compliance with the United States District Court's consent decree regarding compliance with laws related to drainage systems.

68.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

68.description: Enables the authority to work with MBTA to allow commuter rail passes to be used on RIPTA buses.

69.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
69.title: Relating To Sports, Racing And Athletics
69.description: Authorizes the Division of Racing and Athletics to implement online games of skill, including so-called fantasy sports.

70.title: Housing Resources -- Homeless Shelters
70.description: Creates a commission to establish homeless shelter standards.

71.title: Registration Of Vehicles
71.description: Create a special registration plate to honor César E. Chávez.

72.title: Relating To The Exeter-west Greenwich School District
72.description: Amends certain provisions in the agreement forming the Exeter-West Greenwich School District regarding the required quorum to transact business, referenda for the District's annual budget and timing for the payment of apportioned costs.

73.title: Property Subject To Taxation
73.description: Permits the town of Narragansett to establish a tangible business property tax exemption for local small business owners in an amount not to exceed thirty-five thousand dollars ($35,000).

74.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

74.description: Authorizes the creation of the Student Loan Ombudsman within the Division of Higher Education Assistance. The Ombudsman's duties would be to assist student loan borrowers with issues pertaining to their loans.

75.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
75.title: Genetically-engineered Foods
75.description: Requires that any genetically-engineered foods be labeled as such.

77.title: Refuse Disposal
77.description: Authorizes the director of DEM the authority to issue emergency refuse transfer licenses for temporary periods of time.

78.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

78.description: Exempts certain contractors with a combination of 60 years of age and experience from continuing education requirements.

79.title: Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices And Other State Constructions
79.description: Names the section of Route 114 located in Bristol and Warren between the Warren Bridge and the Mount Hope Bridge in memory of 1st Sergeant P. Andrew McKenna.

80.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

80.description: Prohibits an insurer or health care entity from requiring pre-authorization and/or co-payments for certain medical testing prescribed by a physician where the physician determines there is an immediate threat to that person's health.

81.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

81.description: Authorizes operators of developmental disability agencies, acting as a group, to self-insure health care costs for employees, retirees and other beneficiaries and allows a third-party administrator to administer said program.

82.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

82.description: Allows classified employee to be a candidate for elective state office.

83.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
83.title: Miscellaneous Rules
83.description: Makes it an offense to leave a child under seven (7) years of age unattended in a motor vehicle, punishable by a fine of up to one thousand dollars ($1,000), and possible suspension of license not to exceed three (3) years.

85.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
85.title: Assault Of Police Officers And Other Officials
85.description: Raises the maximum penalties for the crime of assault of police officers and other officials from 3 to six 6 years imprisonment and from $1,500 to $3,000.

86.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
86.title: Weapons
86.description: Provides for automatic renewal of a gun permit or license.

87.title: Identification And Apprehension Of Criminals
87.description: Requires the sealing and destruction of arrest records of persons wrongfully arrested.

90.title: Governor's Workforce Board Rhode Island
90.description: Creates a non-trade apprenticeship incentive program for board approved industries.

91.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
91.title: Registration Fees
91.description: Imposes a fee of fifty dollars ($50.00) for the registration of a camping recreational vehicle.

92.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
92.title: Narragansett Bay Commission
92.description: Prohibits the Narragansett Bay Commission and/or DEM from charging fees, inclusive of annual permits, to any business using its own recycling process and not utilizing a public wastewater system (sewer).

93.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
93.title: Transitioning Veterans' Small Business Loan Program
93.description: Creates transitioning veterans' small business loan program under commerce corporation.

94.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
94.title: Personal Income Tax
94.description: Exempts state, federal, and military pensions from state income tax.

97.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
97.title: Personal Income Tax -- Tuition Savings Program
97.description: Increases the amount of contribution to a tuition savings program which can be excluded from adjusted gross income on a Rhode Island income tax return.

98.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
98.title: Teachers' Retirement
98.description: Imposes a yearly earnings limitation on retired teachers serving as substitute teachers.

99.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
99.title: Department Of Administration
99.description: Prohibits state guide plan from requiring any city or town from adopting a housing ordinance that exceeds laws of Rhode Island or city or town's zoning laws.

100.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

100.description: Increases education aid to a community based on community's meeting and surpassing minimum low and moderate income housing requirements.

103.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

105.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

106.title: Foundation Level School Support

107.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
107.title: Relating To Behavioral Healthcare, Developmental Disabilities And Hospitals
107.description: Authorizes the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals to certify recovery housing facilities and programs for residential substance abuse treatment.

108.description: Extends property tax relief for the disabled to those receiving veterans' disability benefits.

109.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
109.title: Relating To Public Property And Works
109.description: Creates a veteran's preference in the issuance of state contracts.

111.title: Authorizing The Town Of Middletown To Finance The Design, Construction, Repair, Rehabilitation And Improvement Of Streets And Sidewalks In The Town, Including, But Not Limited To, Paving, Drainage, Traffic Control Devices, Safety Improvements And Landscaping By The Issuance Of Not More Than $5,000,000 Bonds And/or Notes Therefor
111.description: Authorizes The Town of Middletown to issue not more than $5,000,000 bonds and notes to finance the design, construction, repair, rehabilitation and improvement of streets and sidewalks in the town.

112.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

112.description: Permits passenger and commercial Gloria Gemma Breast Cancer Foundation plates to be issued and sets pre-orders at 900 of all types.

113.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

113.description: Directs the executive office of health and human services to increase income disregards for certain Medicare programs.

114.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

114.description: Provides that municipal insurance corporations be subject to laws regulating insurance companies and be regulated by the Rhode Island department of business regulation.

115.description: Provides protections for consumers and small businesses in the areas of insurance, real estate and accountancy.

116.title: Portsmouth Commercial Fines
116.description: Authorizes the town of Portsmouth to establish a tax stabilization program for legally permitted new commercial construction projects located within its borders.

117.description: Grants the town council of the town of Narragansett the authority to adopt a homestead exemption ordinance.

118.title: Lead Hazard Mitigation

119.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

119.description: Creates an "innocent tenant" exemption from liability for release of hazardous or toxic material.

120.title: License Procedure Chemical Dependency Professionals
120.description: Allows licensed chemical dependency professionals with the proper training to use treatment known as auricular acudetox effective 1/1/2017.

121.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
121.title: The Rhode Island Board Of Education Act
121.description: Amends the implementation of state assessments of students in Rhode Island public schools and directs the DOE to develop its own state assessments.

122.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
122.title: Abandonment Of Cats
122.description: Exempts a "licensed releasing agency" from the offense of abandoning cats.

130.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
130.title: Procedure Generally - Levy And Sale On Execution
130.description: Requires attachments/executions of real estate to describe same with particularity by the recorded legal description, plat and lot number, and any legal description recognized/accepted by title industry for levy to be sufficient.

131.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
131.title: Gambling And Lotteries
131.description: Allows social gaming in private residences and in public taverns or private clubs so long as the gambling is incidental to a bona fide social relationship between the participants and only participants receive anything of value.

132.title: The Edward O. Hawkins And Thomas C. Slater Medical Marijuana Act
132.description: Adds post-traumatic stress disorder as a "debilitating medical condition" and accelerates an approved medical marijuana application for hospice care.

133.title: The Rhode Island Automobile Repossession Act

134.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

135.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

135.description: Imposes a penalty of two thousand dollars ($2,000) upon financial institutions failing to promptly record foreclosure deeds and pay outstanding taxes.

136.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
136.title: Campaign Finance Compliance
136.description: Prevents a person from being a candidate for public office who owes fines, fees, or penalties of ($2,000) or more for campaign finance violations, unless that person is currently compliant with a state board-approved repayment agreement.

138.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

141.title: Freedom From Prone Restraint Act

142.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

143.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

143.description: Creates the "Rhode Island Terminally Ill Patient's Right to Try Act of 2016," which establishes the conditions for the use of experimental treatments for terminally ill patients.

144.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

144.description: Requires children who seek a special limited work permit to successfully complete a worker rights' training program established as funded by the department of labor and training.

148.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

150.last_action: House voted to recommit to House Corporations

150.description: Requires health practitioners and health plan coverage to support clinical practices fostering use of abuse deterrent analgesic drugs product formulations in the same manner as non-abuse deterrent drug formulations.

151.title: Body Works Services Establishments
151.description: Regulates/establishes licensing requirements/procedures for establishment of/personnel in body works services business as opposed to massage therapists and provides civil/criminal penalties for violations.

152.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Riverside Improvement Association Of South Kingston
152.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of The Riverside Improvement Association Of South Kingston

153.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
153.title: Motor Carrier Transportation Contracts
153.description: Renders void/unenforceable motor transportation contract terms holding harmless indemnitee from or against its own negligence/intentional acts/omissions upon the effective date.

155.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

155.description: Prohibits the use of a non-hands-free personal wireless communication device while operating a motor vehicle with certain public or safety personnel and emergency situations.

156.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

157.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

158.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
158.title: Burglary And Breaking And Entering
158.description: Clarifies and imposes increased sanctions for the various classifications of the crime of breaking and entering.

159.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
159.title: Joint Committee Of The Repealer
159.description: Creates the joint committee of the repealer in the general assembly.

161.title: Police Chief Emeritus License Plate--north Providence
161.description: Grants a "Police Chief Emeritus" license plate to North Providence Police Chief (Retired) Ernest Spaziano.

165.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

166.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

170.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

174.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

176.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

363.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
363.title: Contractors’ Registration And Licensing Board
363.description: Establishes the criminal penalty for violating a contractors' board final order by the amount of the monetary judgment imposed.

364.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
364.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions-contractors' Registration And Licensing Board
364.description: Requires an applicant for any license or registration issued by the contractors' licensing board to undergo a national criminal records check, and disqualifies any person previously convicted of certain enumerated felony and misdemeanor offenses.

365.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
365.title: Procedure In Particular Actions
365.description: Provides that no party would be deemed jointly liable in tort for an injury to person or property unless it is determined that such person is at least fifty-one percent (51%) liable in tort for the injury.

366.title: Preliminary Proceedings In District Courts
366.description: Empowers a justice of the peace to receive from an arresting agency, notice of violation of probation or bail that has been received from the attorney general and present the notice to the arrestee.

367.title: Computer Crime
367.description: Defines confidential information and prohibits the intentional and unauthorized access to another's computer, computer system or network with the intent to view, save or copy confidential information contained therein.

368.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
368.title: Break-down Land Use
368.description: Authorizes the state traffic commission to permit the use of break-down lanes for travel and erects signs indicating when and where travel is permitted

369.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
369.title: Control Of Illegal Immigration
369.description: Codifies into law Carcieri's "Illegal Immigration Control Order" which would require the DOA to order the dept to utilize the E-Verify progress to verify the employment eligibility of new hires & businesses doing business for the department.

370.title: Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction And Maintenance Fund -- Tolls
370.description: Authorizes the Rhode Island Turnpike and Bridge Authority to enter into contracts to operate and manage toll facilities on state roads and imposes tolls on such roads.

371.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (02/11/2016)
371.title: Rhode Island Infrastructure Bank
371.description: Authorizes the director of the department of environmental management to issue violations and penalties for violations of provisions of the general laws regarding the Rhode Island infrastructure bank.

372.title: Unfair Claims Settlement Practices Act
372.description: Makes refusing to compensate a claimant for loss of use of a rental vehicle an unfair claims practice.

373.title: Renewable Energy
373.description: Extends the 2004 Renewable Energy Standard Schedule Program, which required the suppliers of retail electricity to purchase increasing minimum amounts of renewable energy from 2019 to 2035.

374.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
374.title: Animal Abuser Registry Act
374.description: Creates the "Animal Abuser Registry Act" which would require all persons convicted of animal abuse to register with an on-line registry to be established and maintained by the attorney general's office.

375.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
375.title: Relating To Elections
375.description: Adds the secretary of state to the board of elections as a nonvoting ex officio member. It also requires the board of canvassers to clearly mark the fifty foot (50') buffer zone at each polling place, where political campaigning is prohibited.

376.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
376.title: Reporting Of Political Contributions By State Vendors
376.description: Prohibits state vendors from making political contributions to candidates that if elected, would have the authority to award state contracts to them.

377.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
377.title: Expungement

378.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
378.title: Willful Trespass
378.description: Provides for a five hundred dollars ($500) fine for first and second convictions for willful trespass, in addition to fines of one thousand dollars ($1000) for third or subsequent convictions.

379.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
379.title: Disorderly Conduct
379.description: Makes certain disorderly conduct offenses subject to a fine of $500 only, while maintaining the current sanctions for disorderly conduct cases involving domestic violence.

380.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
380.title: Public Utilities
380.description: Criminalize injuries to cell/radio towers and increases penalties for injury to electric and communication lines from $3,000 to $50,000; imprisonment from 2 years to 10 years, or both and requires restitution for economic harm.

382.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
382.title: Emergency Police Power
382.description: Amends the emergency police power laws to include other municipal police officers as being subject to the authority of the requesting police chief and permits campus police and municipal departments to enter into mutual aid agreements.

383.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
383.title: Special Police For Private Institutions
383.description: Provides that special police officers have limited jurisdiction on public streets and highway corridors between an educational institution buildings and land areas.

385.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
385.title: The Rhode Island Education Equity Act
385.description: Establishes the Rhode Island Education Equity Act.

386.title: Children
386.description: Prohibits the sale of liquid that is intended for human consumption and/or use in an electronic nicotine-delivery system that is not contained in child-resistant packaging. Also prohibits the use of electronic nicotine delivery systems in schools.

387.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
387.title: Postsecondary Education Performance Funding
387.description: Establishes "The Performance Funding Act of 2016" that would provide that new, unrestricted funding, for Rhode Island's postsecondary state schools be based upon certain performance measures.

388.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
388.title: Lighting District Energy Costs
388.description: Requires the state to pay a lighting district's energy bill, if the lighting district fails to pay it.

390.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
390.title: Indebtedness Of Towns And Cities
390.description: Authorizes cities and towns to issue bonds reflecting loans from municipal road and bridge revolving fund.

391.title: Small Loan Lenders
391.description: Repeals provisions of the general laws regarding "payday lenders".

393.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
393.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers - Notice Of Rate Change
393.description: Requires cable, internet, or telephone providers to provide customers with a written notice (not part of any statement) of any rate increase at least 30 days prior to the effective date of such increase unless the customer shall have previously renewed.

394.title: Condominium Ownership -- Insurance
394.description: Entitles a condominium unit owner to obtain a copy of a damage appraisal within 14 days of request.

395.title: Prescription Drug Benefits
395.description: Regulates business relationship between pharmacy services providers/group health insurers/health service organizations with department of health oversight.

396.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
396.title: The Education Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
396.description: Requires the state to pay for the education of students placed in group homes outside of their municipality.

397.title: General Provisions
397.description: Prohibits the possession sale or trade of shark fins by those without a permit and would make those in violation of this act guilty of a misdemeanor. Permits for limited purposes would be issued by DEM.

398.title: Burial Of Veterans
398.description: Prohibits the walking of any domestic animal on the grounds of the Veterans' Memorial Cemetery in Exeter. An exception would be made for service dogs. Violations would be punished by a fine of not less than five hundred dollars ($500).

399.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
399.title: Code Of Ethics
399.description: Eliminates an exception in the revolving-door rule in the code of ethics.

400.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
400.title: Peace Officers
400.description: Designates certain program workers and shift coordinators at the training school as peace officers while on duty.

401.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
401.title: Reproductive Health Care Act
401.description: Prohibits the state from interfering with a woman's decision to prevent, commence, continue, or terminate a pregnancy prior to fetal viability.

402.title: Estates In Real Property
402.description: Allows conveyances to and from nominee trusts pursuant to certain requirements regarding the preparation and recording of a memorandum of trust.

403.title: Automated Traffic Speed Enforcement System
403.description: Authorizes department of transportation and municipalities to operate automated school zone speed enforcement systems.

404.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
404.title: Laboratories
404.description: Restores certain provisions of chapter 16.2 as well as all of chapter 16.3 of title 23 repealed/deleted in 2015 Budget Act pertaining to definitions/licensing/operation of medical laboratories.

405.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities - Circulating Nurses
405.description: Requires hospital and ambulatory surgical facility operating rooms to have at least one circulating nurse present in each operating room during each surgical procedure.

406.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
406.title: Dual Enrollment Equal Opportunity Act
406.description: Extends the benefits of the dual enrollment equal opportunity act to cover students who participate in at-home instruction.

407.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government- Rhode Island Commission On Women
407.description: Renames commissions as Rhode Island Commission on Women and Girls, allows partnerships with other entities with common concerns, designates any money received from any source as restricted revenues.

408.title: Making Appropriations For The Support Of The State For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2017
408.description: Making Appropriations For The Support Of The State For The Fiscal Year Ending June 30, 2017

409.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
409.title: Judicial Nominating Commission
409.description: Promotes more diversity in the composition of the judicial nominating commission and would require that each list of qualified judicial candidates it submits to the governor for nomination, include a person of color.

410.title: Zoning Ordinances
410.description: Includes family members who are 62 years or older as a reasonable accommodation in an accessory family dwelling unit.

412.title: Vital Records
412.description: Provides that title examiners, attorney, and members of a legally incorporated genealogical society would be allowed to examine death certificates filed with the department of health.

414.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
414.title: Birds
414.description: Legalizes the taking of wild migratory birds by crossbow.

416.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Liability Computation
416.description: Exempts from sales/use tax the purchase/use of telecommunication products/services necessary for receipt/transmission of cable TV/internet access services.

418.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
418.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance
418.description: Eliminates the director's discretion in identifying employers exempted from requirements imposed when an employee works on holidays or Sundays.

419.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
419.title: Arbitration -- Continuance Of Contractual Provisions
419.description: Requires that all contractual provisions contained in an expired collective bargaining agreement with certified school teachers and municipal employees continue until a successor agreement has been reached between the parties.

421.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
421.title: Unfair Sales Practices
421.description: Prohibit price gouging of prescribed drugs or pharmaceuticals in times of market emergency or market shortages and would make violators guilty of a felony and subject to injunctive relief.

423.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
423.title: Motor Vehicle Reparations Act
423.description: Authorizes regulations prohibiting certain auto insurance rate setting practices.

424.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
424.title: Off-label Uses Of Prescription Drugs
424.description: Requires insurance coverage for off-label prescription drugs when there is evidence in peer-reviewed medical literature to support their use.

425.title: Truck Weight Limits
425.description: Prohibits commercial motor trucks or tractors with a gross weight exceeding four (4) tons from traveling on that portion of Route 116 known as Smith Avenue in the town of Smithfield.

426.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
426.title: Renewable Energy Growth Program
426.description: Expands the renewable energy growth program for an additional ten (10) years after the fifth program year, with an annual target of forty (40) nameplate megawatts for each year of the ten (10) year period.

427.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
427.title: Meaningful Access To Accurate Provider Directories
427.description: Requires health insurers to maintain accurate and up-to-date directories of all in-network providers, and provides that information to plan enrollees.

428.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
428.title: Department Of Health
428.description: Allows parents or guardians of a child to opt out of vaccines for non-casual contact diseases transmitted by sexual contact.

430.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
430.title: Parole Board
430.description: Requires that parole board members serve no more than three (3) terms and applies prospectively to new appointments and re-appointments.

431.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
431.title: Humane Alternatives To Long-term Solitary Confinement
431.description: Limits the time an inmate can spend in segregated confinement, prohibits the segregated confinement of certain vulnerable persons, and creates more humane and effective methods of instituting such confinement.

432.title: Trust
432.description: Permits the settlor of a trust to provide for a person other than the trustee to direct actions of the trustee, and clearly establishes the legal responsibilities of trust advisors and trust protectors.

433.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
433.title: Historian Laureate Of Rhode Island
433.description: Gives the appointment of the historian laureate of Rhode Island to the governor rather than the secretary of state.

434.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
434.title: Crime Against The Public Trust
434.description: Establishes crimes against the public trust and criminal penalties and civil damages for illegal trust offenses. It would set a 10 year criminal statute of limitations and provide for possible pension revocation or reduction for any job-related felony.

435.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
435.title: Public Corruption And White Collar Crime Unit
435.description: Codifies the public corruption and white collar crime unit within the department of attorney general.

436.title: Commercial Real Estate Broken Lien
436.description: Creates an avenue to challenge the legal viability of a recorded commercial real estate broker's notice of lien for their unpaid and owing commercial real estate sales commission bill.

437.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
437.title: Relating To Education-unhealthy Food And Beverage Advertising
437.description: Prohibits the advertising of unhealthy food and beverage products in schools.

438.title: Holocaust Genocide Education
438.description: Requires the inclusion of instruction on holocaust and genocide studies in the curriculum for all middle and high school students.

439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
439.title: Physician Assistants
439.description: Modernizes the statutes regulating physician assistants (PAs) by providing for collaboration between physicians and physician assistants,

440.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
440.title: Drive-through Windows -- Assistance To Deaf And Hard-of-hearing
440.description: Requires establishments selling drinks or food via drive-through windows to install at the ordering station serving each such window, equipment to be used to assist the deaf and hard-of-hearing in ordering, and train its personnel to use such equipment.

442.title: Licensing Of Online Contests
442.description: Authorizes, licenses, and regulates daily fantasy sports games contests to be offered online.

445.title: Law Practice
445.description: Imposes an occupational tax on visiting attorneys appearing before the courts of this state, including those admitted pro hac vice.

446.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
446.title: Department Of Environmental Management - State Beaches User Fees
446.description: Prohibits the department of environmental management from charging parking fees to Rhode Island residents or motor vehicles registered in the state at state beaches between July 2, 2016 and July 8, 2016.

447.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
447.title: Sales And Use Taxes--liability And Computation
447.description: Establishes a 10 year statute of limitations on the collection of any business tax and/or personal income tax owed to the division of taxation.

448.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
448.title: Form And Effect Of Conveyances
448.description: Amends certain provisions relative to mortgage transfers and restricts the recording of mortgages in anyone's name other than the holder of the note secured by the mortgage.

449.title: Retail Licenses
449.description: Allows class A liquor retail license holders to serve unlimited samples of wine products available for purchase on one occasion each year.

450.title: Licensing Of Health Care Facilities
450.description: Defines freestanding emergency care facilities subject to health care facilities licensing, emergency medical transportation, regulations and determination of need for new health care equipment and new institutional health services purposes.

451.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
451.title: Board Of Medical Licensure And Discipline
451.description: Prohibits health care providers from sending collection letter or reporting failure of patient to pay debt requiring credit card number before rendering medical treatment if the patient has HSA as part of employer-offered insurance coverage.

453.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
453.title: Workers' Compensation Death Benefits
453.description: Allows surviving spouses entitled to workers' compensation death benefits to receive annual cost-of-living increases in the amount of the total percent of increase in the CPI-W, as opposed to the existing four percent (4%) cost-of-living increase.

454.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
454.title: Relating To Towns And Cities-relief Of Injured And Deceased Firefighters And Police Officers
454.description: Adds campus police officers to the group of public safety officials eligible to collect salary, wages, benefits during periods of whole/partial incapacitation incurred while on-duty or while providing emergency assistance within the state while off-duty.

455.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
455.title: Payment Of Wages
455.description: Prohibits employers from deducting from their employees' wages for spoilage, breakage, cash shortages, losses, fines or penalties for tardiness, misconduct or quitting by an employee without notice.

456.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
456.title: Powers And Operations
456.description: Limits the amount of money that can be added and collected by persons or entities who purchase charged-off credit card debt.

457.title: Catastrophic Health Insurance Plan Act
457.description: Requires public hearing or meeting, for all insurers or health maintenance organizations who propose rate increases for health or dental insurance coverage in the individual market.

458.title: Unpiloted Aerial Vehicle Regulation
458.description: Grants exclusive authority subject to federal law, to the state of Rhode Island and the Rhode Island Airport Corporation to regulate unpiloted aerial vehicles, remotely piloted aircraft, drones, and unmanned aircraft systems.

462.title: Hours And Scheduling
462.description: Requires employers to give their employees at least two (2) weeks' notice of their work schedule and other notices scheduling rights and remedies.

463.title: Health And Safety Of Pupils -- Child Abuse Hotline
463.description: Requires posting in every public school of a sign providing the telephone number of the child abuse hotline.

464.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
464.title: Curriculum
464.description: Requires the department of elementary and secondary education, pursuant to rules promulgated by the commissioner of elementary and secondary education, to develop curricular material on financial literacy.

466.title: School Social Workers
466.description: Creates a process for the department of education collection and organization of information concerning the workload and scope of the duties and responsibility performed by school social workers.

467.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
467.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Narragansett
467.description: Changes the method by which Narragansett calculates its elderly tax exemption by adopting a needs-based and percentage of income formula.

472.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
472.title: Relating To Weapons
472.description: Prohibits students from having knives on their possession while in school.

473.title: Hotels
473.description: Requires hotel operators to provide requesting law enforcement agencies with certain identifying information regarding patrons.

474.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
474.title: Relating Criminal Offenses - Uniform Act On Prevention Of And Remedies For Human Trafficking
474.description: Establishes penalties and remedies for human trafficking and makes human trafficking and human trafficking for purposes of sexual servitude, forced labor, commercial sexual activity felonies punishable by imprisonment and fines.

475.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
475.title: Easements
475.description: Establishes the rights and obligations of property owners concerning the maintenance of private easements and rights-of-way.

477.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
477.title: Voting Booth
477.description: Raises the age of children that can accompany a voter in the voter booth, from under the age of thirteen (13) to under the age of eighteen (18).

478.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
478.title: Condominium Law
478.description: Amends the rules for newspaper publication of notices of condominium lien foreclosure.

479.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure-criminal Injuries Compensation
479.description: Increases the emergency fund pursuant to the Criminal Injuries Compensation Act for burial expenses from $8,000 to $10,000 and increases the emergency relocation costs from $2,000 to $5,000.

480.title: Reciprocity Agreements - Foreign Driver Licenses
480.description: Allows the administrator of motor vehicles to make agreements to recognize foreign drivers' licenses and require the administrator to adopt rules and regulations setting forth the standards for such agreements.

482.title: Expungement Of Criminal Records
482.description: Allows those persons with less than 6 misdemeanor convictions to file a motion for the expungement.

483.title: Electronic Imaging Devices
483.description: Prohibits a person from electronically disseminating visual images of another engaged in sexually explicit conduct where a reasonable person would know the image was to remain private.

484.title: Criminal Injuries Compensation
484.description: Makes residents of the state of Rhode Island who are victims of terrorist acts outside the state of Rhode Island but within the United States, eligible to receive victim's compensation payments under this chapter.

485.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
485.title: Primary Date
485.description: Changes the day of party primary elections from the second Tuesday after the first Monday in September each even numbered year, to the first Saturday in September.

488.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers
488.description: Includes online impersonation and electronic dissemination of indecent materials to minors as offenses for which an internet service provider must give subscriber information to the attorney general.

490.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
490.title: Auditor General
490.description: Directs auditor general to assign a special auditor whose sole function is to perform regular/forensic audits of DOT and all construction projects put out to bid/managed/supervised by DOT.

492.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
492.title: Retirement System - Administration
492.description: Requires the auditor general to perform a ten (10) year forensic audit of the state's retirement system concerning the rate of return, expenses paid, the relationship between the return and expenses and the transparency of the fee agreements.

496.title: Public Service Corporation Tax
496.description: Clarifies depreciation with respect to the net book value of a company's tangible personal property, by providing that the accumulated depreciation reduction takes into account physical deterioration and functional and economic obsolescence.

498.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
498.title: Capital Development Program
498.description: Provides for a bond referendum which would authorize the issuance of bonds for Affordable Housing in the amount of one hundred million dollars ($100,000,000), at the election to be held in November, 2016.

499.title: Division Of Developmental Disabilities
499.description: Mandates that health employees working for state operated community and residential facilities receive a minimum of $13.97 per hour and that such rate would be adjusted annually.

500.title: Deferred Compensation Plans
500.description: Provides the state with the flexibility to engage up to three (3) authorized companies to administer its deferred compensation plans rather than the current statutory mandate to hire three (3) companies to do this task.

501.title: Renaming Bridge #550 Located On Route 95 And The Pawtucket River In The City Of Pawtucket
501.description: Renames the Pawtucket River Bridge to "The Mayor James E. Doyle Pawtucket River Bridge."

504.title: Tax Preferences
504.description: Requires any law authorizing a tax preference enacted after January 1, 2017 to contain specific goals and objectives and provides for detailed performance indicators.

505.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
505.title: Jobs Incentive Program
505.description: Exempts the eligibility of the qualified jobs incentive program to employers with less employees than is currently required, and removes the mandatory tax credit amount of seven thousand five hundred dollars ($7,500) to eligible employers.

506.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
506.title: Employment Security - Benefits
506.description: Increases the maximum weekly unemployment benefit rate to the higher of fifty-seven and one-half percent (57.5%) of the average weekly wages paid to workers in the prior calendar year or six hundred sixteen dollars ($616) per week.

507.title: The Rhode Island Bridge And Turnpike Authority--toll Evaders
507.description: Repeals the law providing for additional penalties for toll evaders on Rhode Island bridges and turnpikes.

508.title: Motor Vehicle And Trailer Excise Tax Elimination Act Of 1998
508.description: Exempts from the excise tax any vehicle or trailer with a valuation of five thousand dollars ($5,000) or less.

509.title: Tax Amnesty
509.description: Repeals the Rhode Island Tax Amnesty Acts of 1986, 1996, 2006, and 2012.

510.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
510.title: Firefighters' Arbitration
510.description: Provides in the case of firefighters' and municipal police arbitration, that all provisions contained in a prior collective bargaining agreement continue until a successor agreement has been reached or an interest arbitration award has been rendered.

512.title: Police Arbitration
512.description: Authorizes the parties to a police collective bargaining agreement to extend the period during which they meet by written agreement.

514.title: Firefighters' Arbitrations
514.description: Allows parties to fire fighter's contract negotiation to extend the thirty (30) day bargaining period before submitting unresolved issues to arbitration.

515.title: Relating To Commercial Law-general Regulatory Provisions-deceptive Trade Practices
515.description: Makes discretionary the formerly mandatory requirement that civil investigative demands of alleged deceptive practices be filed in the Superior Court.

516.title: Registration Suspension For Failure To Pay Tolls
516.description: Permits the division of motor vehicles to refuse to register or transfer the registration of a vehicle which is subject to unpaid tolls.

519.title: Rhode Island Real Estate Time-share Act - Termination Of Time Shares
519.description: Amends the RI Real Estate Time-Share Act to provide for dissolution of the time-share form of ownership by fewer than 60% of the owners in certain circumstances.

520.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
520.title: Weapons--the Protect Rhode Island Families Act
520.description: Requires the surrender of firearms to law enforcement agencies after conviction of certain domestic violence offenses.

522.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
522.title: Geoengineering
522.description: Defines and limits the use of solar radiation management climate geoengineering in the state.

523.title: The Rhode Island Works Program And The Public Assistance Act
523.description: Requires persons seeking/receiving funds under RI Works Program/Public Assistance Act to attend complete financial literacy seminar within 45 days of receipt extensions or face a 10% reduction effective January 1, 2017.

524.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
524.title: The Paul W. Crowley Rhode Island Student Investment Initiative
524.description: Establishes a mandatory reporting requirement for all students in grades K-12 for any assessments administered, along with specifics which must be included in the report.

525.title: Relating To Human Services-child Care-state Subsidies
525.description: Requires the department of human services to establish a searchable online database, accessible to all certified family-child care providers, for the purpose of monitoring the status of all co-payments owed by families receiving child care assistance.

526.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
526.title: Student Online Personal Information Protection Act
526.description: Prohibits providers of online services to schools grade K-12 from using students' identifications to create profiles for any use other than school-related.

529.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
529.title: Net Metering
529.description: Expands the state's net metering policy to include renewable energy projects in which energy is distributed off-site from a customer's account and would establish an energy system credit benefit or charge.

531.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
531.title: Insurance Rates
531.description: Prevents the consideration of an applicant's credit history in determining automobile insurance rates.

532.title: Itinerant Vendors
532.description: Repeals the chapter of the general laws regulating itinerant vendors and their various licensing requirements, responsibilities, and duties.

533.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
533.title: State Budget
533.description: Requires the budget officer to include in the annual state budget the estimates of revenues and requests for appropriations of the various quasi-public corporations presented in a line item format.

535.title: State Police
535.description: Provides that the state fire marshal, chief deputy state fire marshals, director of the Rhode Island fire academy, and deputy state fire marshals, be considered members of the Rhode Island state police for purposes of retirement benefits.

539.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
539.title: Construction And Maintenance Of State Roads
539.description: Requires the department of transportation to disclose information regarding the award and contract amount for road construction or repair projects.

540.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
540.title: Atlantic Time Zone
540.description: Provides for Rhode Island's adoption of the Atlantic Time Zone if and when Massachusetts does so.

541.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
541.title: Fair Housing Practices
541.description: Prohibits discrimination in housing against those persons who have a lawful source of income.

542.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
542.title: Access
542.description: Grants the general assembly access to limited governmental records, needed to exercise proper oversight over state budget programs, including economic development programs.

544.title: Rhode Island Turnpike And Bridge Authority
544.description: Imposes administrative fees upon individuals who fail to make timely payments of toll amounts, and subjects toll evaders to license suspension or fines pursuant to jurisdiction of the Rhode Island traffic tribunal.

548.title: Trespass And Actions For Possession
548.description: Prohibits encroachment of open space land and allows for a civil action in superior court to remedy any encroachment.

549.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
549.title: Proceedings In Family Court
549.description: Prohibits detention of children under 12 at the training school unless offense is capital or felony sexual offense if charged as adult. Court must still consider other reasonable placement in that case.

550.last_action: Committee postponed at request of sponsor (02/24/2016)
550.title: Arrest
550.description: Adds inspectors of the public utilities commission and division of motor carriers to the definition of "peace officers" with arrest powers.

551.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
551.title: Operators' License
551.description: Allows DMV to issue driving privilege licenses/permits to applicants unable to establish lawful presence in US which are not valid for ID purposes effective July 1, 2017.

552.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
552.title: Partial - Birth Abortion
552.description: Amends and revises the definitions and penalties pertaining to partial-birth abortions. Further provides that any physician who knowingly performs a partial-birth abortion would be guilty of a felony and may be liable for civil penalties and fines.

553.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
553.title: Spousal Notice For Abortion
553.description: Repeals the requirement of notice to husband of a patient before an abortion procedure.

554.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
554.title: The Healthy Pregnancies For Incarcerated Women Act
554.description: Prohibits the use of restraints on pregnant female prisoners during transport to court during the third trimester of pregnancy, and would require DOC to submit annual reports to the general assembly regarding the number of pregnant women at the ACI.

557.title: Insurance--mental Illness And Substance Abuse
557.description: Requires comprehensive discharge planning for patients treated for substance use disorders, opioid overdoses and chronic addiction and would require insurers to cover expanded medication-assisted addiction treatment.

558.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
558.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Illness And Substance Abuse
558.description: Requires health practitioners/health plan coverage to support clinical practices fostering use of abuse-deterrent opioid analgesic drug product formulations approved by the U.S. Food and Drug Administration.

559.last_action: House passed Sub A as amended (floor amendment)
559.title: Health Insurance
559.description: Prohibits health insurance insurers from discriminating against any health care provider, who is acting within the scope of their license or certification, concerning participation and coverage in their plan.

561.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
561.title: Wine Direct Shipper License
561.description: Creates a wine direct shipper license.

562.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
562.title: Public Motor Vehicles
562.description: Prohibits the operator of a public motor vehicle from transporting any passenger unless the pickup time is prearranged at least two (2) hours before the actual pickup.

565.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
565.title: Unsolicited Sending Of Goods
565.description: Makes the unsolicited sending of goods unlawful and would regulate trial and introductory rate offers. Also makes violations of section unfair trade practices as defined in §6-13.1-1.

567.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
567.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Esthetician
567.description: Amends various sections of law relating to the certification, training and licensing of barbers, hairdressers, cosmeticians, manicurists and estheticians.

568.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
568.title: State Building Code
568.description: Requires that all plot plans be prepared by professional engineers, professional surveyors or registered architects, and would prohibit anyone acting under their direct supervision from preparing such plans, drawings or specifications.

569.title: Minimum Wages
569.description: Grants employees several additional avenues to help them collect their wages from nonpaying employers, set forth penalties for nonpayment of wages by an employer, and implements a new procedure for filing of claims.

570.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
570.title: Workers' Compensation--benefits
570.description: Allows an employer or workers' compensation insurer to recover any overpayments of benefits made to the injured employee by set-off against future payments due to an employee for loss of use or of disfigurement.

571.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
571.title: Relating To Labor And Labor Relations – Tip Protection
571.description: Prohibits employers from receiving any portion of the tips given by customers to their servers.

572.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
572.title: Workers' Compensation Benefits - Disfigurement
572.description: Restricts the awarding of disfigurement workers' compensation benefits to scarring of the neck, face, and hands and prohibits them from being awarded less than one year from the date of the disfiguring event.

573.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
573.title: Workers' Compensation -- Benefits
573.description: Broadens the definition of "suitable alternative employment". It also expands the circumstances under which an earning capacity can be set by the workers' compensation court.

574.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
574.title: Relating To Labor And Labor Relations-healthy And Safe Families And Workplaces Act
574.description: Requires all employers to provide their employees with a minimum level of paid sick and safety leave including time to care for the employee’s family members.

576.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
576.title: Pharmacies
576.description: Expands a pharmacist's immunization authority for individuals between the ages of 9 and 18.

577.title: The Youth Protection Act
577.description: Requires certain persons who have contact with children to get criminal records checks.

578.title: Nursing Assistants
578.description: Allows nursing and related professionals to practice under supervision of an RN without certain registration requirements.

579.title: Court Administration
579.description: Removes the thirty (30) day mail notice requirement which must be provided to those owing overdue court fees due prior to their names being published.

580.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
580.title: School And Youth Programs Concussion Act
580.description: Requires all school districts to designate an athletic trainer to be available for high school athletic practices and games.

582.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
582.title: Prohibition Of Containers Using Bisphenol A
582.description: Prohibits the use of containers, or food packaged in containers that contain bisphenol A.

583.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
583.title: Formaldehyde Control
583.description: Prohibits the use of formaldehyde or formaldehyde replacements in certain children's products.

584.title: Curriculum -- Free Play Recess
584.description: Requires public schools to provide student in grades kindergarten through five (5) with at least twenty (20) minutes of free-play recess each school day.

585.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
585.title: Veterinary Practice
585.description: Allows non-veterinarians to perform certain husbandry procedures that are commonly performed by owners of animal pets and livestock.

586.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
586.title: Relating To Animals And Animal Husbandry- Number Of Cats Allowed
586.description: Limits the number of cats per household to ten (10) without special permission.

592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
592.title: Monuments And Memorials
592.description: Designates the Honor and Remember flag as Rhode Island's emblem for service and sacrifice of people in the armed forces who have lost their life in the line of duty.

593.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
593.title: Fireworks Sales Ordinances
593.description: Authorizes cities and towns to regulate by ordinance the sale of pyrotechnics within their boundaries and to set a sales license fee of not more than $1,000.

595.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
595.title: Board Of Regents For Elementary And Secondary Education
595.description: Requires that the council of elementary and secondary education take into consideration the time and cost of transporting students and other programs that impact the education of students.

596.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
596.title: Relating To Health And Safety- Lila Manfield Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act
596.description: Creates Sapinsley Compassionate Care Act to provide mechanism for terminally ill patient to choose to end their life using physician prescribed drugs.

598.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
598.title: Certification Of Teachers
598.description: Requires that teachers be certified in first aid, cardiopulmonary resuscitation and automated external defibrillator (AED) use prior to teacher certification, with exceptions for the disabled and those employed in a school which lacks AED device.

600.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
600.title: Abused & Neglected Children
600.description: Expands the reporting requirement for abuse, neglect, or death of a child to include the governor, the director of the department of health, the speaker and the senate president and the posting of the report on the child advocate website.

601.title: Public Health And Workplace Safety Act
601.description: Prohibits the use of electronic nicotine-delivery system products in enclosed public places and enclosed facilities within places of employment.

603.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
603.title: Workers' Compensation Medical Advisory Board
603.description: Adds a doctor of acupuncture and Oriental medicine to the medical advisory board at the workers' compensation court, and respects patient choice in the selection of treatment therapies for certain conditions.

605.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
605.title: Medical Assistance Fraud
605.description: Increases the penalties from up to $500 and up to six (6) months incarceration up to $1,000 and one year incarceration for knowingly making false statements made relative to certification or recertification of medical care facilities.

606.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
606.title: Sale Of Ivory Or Rhinoceros Horns
606.description: Prohibits any person from importing, selling, offering for sale, purchasing, bartering, or possessing with intent to sell, any ivory, ivory product, rhinoceros horn, or rhinoceros horn product, with limited exception & provides for fines for violations .

607.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
607.title: Commercial Real Estate Broker Lien
607.description: Establishes a process by which a notice of lien filed by a commercial real estate broker may be promptly challenged in court.

608.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
608.title: Explosives - Notice
608.description: Expands the notice requirements relating to the use of explosives by requiring 2 weeks' notice to the municipality and owners of structures within 500 feet of mutual property line.

609.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
609.title: Maintenance Of Private Easements And Rights-of-way
609.description: Establishes the rights and obligations of property owners concerning the maintenance of private easements and rights-of-way.

611.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
611.title: Protecting Student Privacy On School-owned Technology
611.description: Establishes privacy rights in regard to take-home technology devices from school. Limits the ability of school officials to monitor and search a student's take-home technology device and would establish criteria before a search could be done.

612.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
612.title: Relating Criminals-correctional Institutions - Parole
