612.description: Permits prisoners sentenced as adults to life or to lengthy sentences for offenses committed prior to age eighteen eligible for parole after completing fifteen years of their sentence.

613.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
613.title: Student Journalists' Freedom Of Expression Act
613.description: Creates the Student Journalists' Freedom of Expression Act protecting student journalists' right to exercise freedom of speech in school-sponsored media.

615.title: Suspension Or Revocation Of Licenses -- Violations
615.description: Makes driving on a suspended or expired license, or without a license a civil infraction and would transfer jurisdiction to the RI Traffic Tribunal. It also makes any license suspension as a penalty discretionary and not mandatory.

616.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
616.title: Second Amendment Preservation Act
616.description: Prohibits the use of state funds, personnel or property in the enforcement of federal firearms laws or regulations.

617.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
617.title: Pen Registers And Trap And Trace Devices
617.description: Prohibits the use of a stingray cell-site simulator device by any law enforcement agency except upon application for its use and the granting of its order by the presiding justice of the superior court.

618.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
618.title: Search Warrants
618.description: Requires the sealing of an application for a search warrant unless the court issuing the warrant issues an order granting relief from the seal.

620.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
620.title: Condominium Law -- Management Contracts
620.description: Requires condominium unit owners' association officers to verify that management agents or companies retained by the association are insured with respect to the services they provide to the condominium.

622.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
622.title: Small Claims
622.description: Raises the total amount of damages the state can recover in a false claim act action from three times the actual damages to five times.

623.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
623.title: Non-competition Agreements
623.description: Declares non-competition agreements unenforceable in the state unless integral to the sale of a business interest or the dissolution of a partnership or the withdrawal of a partner from a partnership.

629.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
629.title: Employment Security--benefits
629.description: Provides an accelerated process and benefits for persons claiming unemployment benefits after voluntarily leaving work for circumstances resulting from domestic abuse.

630.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
630.title: Fair Pay Act
630.description: Increases the scope of protections and remedies available to employees who are discriminated against in their wages due to their sex.

632.title: Rhode Island Comprehensive Planning And Land Use Act
632.description: Extends the date for comprehensive land use plans to be brought into conformance with the provisions of the Rhode Island Comprehensive Planning and Land Use Regulation Act to July 1, 2017.

633.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
633.title: Rhode Island Development Impact Fee Act
633.description: Amends provisions of the Rhode Island Development Impact Fee Act regarding the basis for impact fees, the need for impact fees for new schools, impact fees for low, moderate and age restricted housing, and how municipalities manage impact fees accounts.

636.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
636.title: Minimum Energy And Water Efficiency Standards
636.description: Sets specific, up-to-date standards for selected commercial and residential products. These energy and water efficiency standards are based on ENERGY STAR specifications or on standards adopted by various states.

638.last_action: Referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
638.title: Air Pollution
638.description: Regulates the phase-out of wood stoves without EPA certification in densely populated residential areas.

639.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
639.title: Hawkers And Peddlers
639.description: Exempts applicant for hawkers/peddlers license holding a valid unexpired hackney operator's license issued by the division of PUC from any city/town requirement to undergo criminal background checks.

641.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
641.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles
641.description: Permits a motor fuel sales business with full service gas dispensers and also engaged in auto repair to obtain a limited dealers' license allowing the display and sale of not more than two (2) vehicles at a time.

642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
642.title: The Identity Theft Protection Act Of 2015
642.description: Reduces the time a person or government agency who stores personal information has to disclose a breach of that information security to 14 days; breaches affecting more than 500 people must be reported to the AG and major credit bureaus within 24 hrs.

643.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
643.title: Health Care Services - Utilization Review Act
643.description: Transfers utilization review from department of health to office of health insurance commissioner (OHIC) to review/regulate adequacy of health plan networks effective 1/1/17.

646.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
646.title: Consumer Car Information And Choice Act
646.description: Requires all aspects relating to connected car vehicle electronic data from generation to sharing and provides consumer rights relating to access and sharing.

647.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
647.title: Guaranteed Asset Protection
647.description: Authorizes motor vehicle dealers to issue guaranteed asset protection waivers to consumers while providing consumer protections for guaranteed asset protection waivers.

649.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
649.title: Sales And Use Taxes -- Liability And Computation
649.description: Exempts feminine hygiene and some home health care products from sales tax, and reduces the clothing exemption from $250 to $240.

655.title: In Amendment Of And In Addition To Chapter 286 Of The Public Laws Of 1986, Entitled "authorizing The Towns Of Charlestown, Richmond And Hopkinton, To Join A Regional School District, Incorporating Said Regional School District, And Providing For The Issuance Of Bonds, Construction And Operation Of A Regional School For The Joint Use Of The Participating Towns, Within Said Regional School District Established By This Act, " As Amended
655.description: Bases the composition of the Chariho Regional School on more recent population schedules.

656.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
656.title: Department Of Environmental Management -- User Fees
656.description: Establishes a restricted receipt account for beach and park user fees, and direct the department of environmental management to report receipts and disbursements annually to the general assembly.

657.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
657.title: 911 Emergency Telephone Number Act -- Prepaid Wireless E911 Charge Act
657.description: Creates a restricted receipt account for all 911 funds and requires that they be used solely for the operation of the 911 system. Authorizes the PUC to reduce 911 surcharges to the extent they exceed the sums needed to operate the 911 system.

658.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
658.title: Gold Star Parents
658.description: Creates a special license plate for Gold Star Parents.

659.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
659.title: Taxation Of Beverage Containers, Hard-to-dispose Material And Litter Control Participation Permittee
659.description: Repeals the imposition of the tax on hard-to-dispose material.

660.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
660.title: Retirement System - Contributions And Benefits - Retired Teachers
660.description: Permits retired teachers to exceed earnings limits if the department of education determines there is a shortage of teachers in their subject.

663.title: Medical Assistance--long-term Care Service And Finance Reform
663.description: Provides for Medicaid rate adjustment in parity with MA and CT for health care services provided in the home and develops annual adjustments to home care providers, home nursing care providers, and hospice provider reimbursement rates.

664.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
664.title: Military Retirement
664.description: Excludes for the purposes of Rhode Island state income taxes, the first twenty-five thousand dollars ($25,000) of military retirement income, paid by the state or federal government, to persons sixty-five (65) years or older.

665.title: Retirement Security Act For Locally Administered Pension Funds
665.description: Requires municipalities to include a 20 year amortization schedule with its annual report every 3 years and provides an alternative funding critical status funding plan to state officials.

666.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
666.title: Fiscal Notes
666.description: Requires an economic impact statement to accompany any proposed legislation affecting businesses operating in this state.

668.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
668.title: Cigarette Tax-minimum Price Of Cigarettes
668.description: Requires that a fifteen percent (15%) minimum markup be added to the total cost of cigarettes sold by retailers.

669.title: Maintenance Of Town Highways - Hotline
669.description: Directs the department of transportation to set up a pothole report toll-free telephone line.

670.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
670.title: Quality Care For Persons With Developmental Disabilities
670.description: Requires that every employer who provides services to persons with developmental disabilities, which are reimbursed for such services by the state, pay their employees fifteen dollars ($15.00) an hour.

671.title: Anti-discrimination In State Contracts
671.description: Prohibits discrimination in the distribution of state contracts.

673.title: Regulation Of Vicious Dogs
673.description: Repeals the law on the control of vicious dogs and amends the definition of vicious dog.

675.last_action: Committee recommended Substitute A be held for further study
675.title: Delegation Of Non-ablative Treatments
675.description: Provides guidelines for the delegation by licensed health care professionals of non-ablative laser or energy-based treatments to a properly-qualified delegate.

677.title: Start-up Rhode Island Tax Free Zone Program
677.description: Establishes tax free zones in conjunction with state universities and colleges and relieves new businesses in RI of paying any taxes for a period of up to 10 years.

679.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
679.title: Residence Of Children For School Purposes
679.description: Requires the department of education and the DCYF to develop a procedure to ensure that the municipalities where group homes or other residential facilities are located are reimbursed for the educational expenses above the cost allocated.

680.title: E-911 Uniform Emergency Telephone System Division
680.description: Requires E-911 system division to update system by allowing user access by text or internet.

681.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
681.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure
681.description: Permits a person who has wrongfully been sentenced to imprisonment to bring an action for compensation and damages.

684.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
684.title: Taxation And Regulation Of Marijuana
684.description: Removes the state's prohibition on adults using, possessing, and cultivating marijuana for personal use. Establishes a system of regulated marijuana retail distribution to adults 21 and older and imposes taxes at both the wholesale and retail level.

685.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
685.title: Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact
685.description: Creates the Psychology Interjurisdictional Compact that would regulate the practice of telepsychology (psychological services using a form of telecommunications) by psychologists across state boundaries.

689.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
689.title: Powers And Duties Of Director
689.description: Gives the director of the department of environmental management the authority to terminate and revoke licenses issued by the department if conditions leading to a suspension are not connected.

692.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
692.title: Liability Insurance
692.description: Requires any insurance company to reveal the limits of liability coverage to a party making claim for personal injury or property damage.

693.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
693.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-computer Crime
693.description: Makes it unlawful to post a message through the use of any medium, without the intended recipient’s consent, if the contact would amount to 2 or more incidents of unconsented contact and such contact would cause the recipient to feel frightened.

694.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
694.title: Relating To Health And Safety
694.description: Prohibits abortions solely as a means of sex selection.

695.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
695.title: Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction And Maintenance Fund
695.description: Adds a prohibition on the transfer of certain data collected at or from a tolling facility.

696.title: Child Custody
696.description: Allows a parent to introduce evidence in a family court child custody dispute, from an expert, alleging the existence of parental alienation syndrome by the other parent.

697.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
697.title: Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction And Maintenance Fund--tolls
697.description: Requires that any toll facility shall if it engages in enforcement of traffic laws do so only as authorized by §§42-13.1-11 and 42-13.1-12.

701.title: The Interstate Medical Licensure Compact
701.description: Establishes Rhode Island’s membership in the interstate medical licensure compact. It details the procedure to be followed in order to allow physicians to become licensed in multiple states, while ensuring the safety of patients.

702.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
702.title: Recovery High Schools Act
702.description: Removes school district approval from the enrollment process for recovery high school students and requires the transfer of the core instructional amount per pupil.

704.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
704.title: Relating To Businesses And Professions
704.description: Makes it easier for military service members and their spouses to obtain certifications and licenses issued by the department of labor and training.

708.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
708.title: Fees For State Colleges And Universities - Veterans
708.description: Authorizes state run higher education institutions to waive application and transcript fees for veterans.

712.title: The Medical Billing Innovation Act Of 2016
712.description: Empowers the health insurance commissioner to establish payor guidelines to develop and maintain a system allowing patients electronic access to their health claims information pursuant to federal regulations by 7/1/17.

713.title: Federal Old-age And Survivors' Insurance
713.description: Repeals the requirement that the general treasurer submit an annual report regarding federal old-age and survivors' insurance to the general assembly.

714.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
714.title: Rhode Island Sales And Use Tax Reimbursement Act
714.description: Provides that in the event sales and use tax revenue exceeds projections, then in such event the tax administrator shall reduce the sales tax rate by one percent (1%) until the end of the fiscal year.

716.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
716.title: Motion Picture Production Tax Credits
716.description: Utilizes rebates instead of tax credits and increases the available amounts.

717.title: Corrections Department--sickness And Injury Pay For Corrections Personnel
717.description: Provides corrections personnel working in security or directly with inmates full pay and benefits, including reimbursement for non-insurance paid medical expenses.

718.title: The Providence Port Advisory Council
718.description: Creates the Providence port advisory council to provide advice and support with respect to coordinating and marketing the commercial maritime resources of all ports in the state.

719.title: Authorizing The Town Of Portsmouth To Issue General Obligation Bonds And/or Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $10,000,000 For The Design, Construction, Equipping And Furnishing Of A New Police Station In The Town
719.description: Authorizes the town of Portsmouth to issue ten million dollars ($10,000,000) of general obligation bonds and/or notes in order to design, construct, equip and furnish a new police station.

720.title: Public Finance Management Board
720.description: Empowers the PFMB to advise/assist city/town or municipal/regional board/commission/agency relating to issuance/financial planning of general obligation notes/bonds without local entity request.

722.title: Bonding And Leasing Authority Of Cities And Towns
722.description: Requires public finance management board approval of municipal leases in excess of one million dollars ($1,000,000) and notice to the board of the issuance of new borrowing obligations.

723.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
723.title: Stalking
723.description: Prohibits stalking defined as a course of conduct by anyone who may cause a reasonable person to either fear for their own safety or the safety of a third person or cause a reasonable person to suffer emotional distress. Enumerates penalties for stalking.

729.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
729.title: Medical Marijuana Act
729.description: Defines term "dried" as having moisture content of 10% or less.

733.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
733.title: Compassion Centers
733.description: Increases number of permits for medical marijuana compassion centers from 3 to 6 with certain geographical limitations.

738.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
738.title: Blackstone Valley Wastewater Treatment Authority Act
738.description: Establishes the Blackstone Valley Wastewater Treatment Authority, and would prescribe its powers and duties.

739.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
739.title: Health Care Facilities Staffing
739.description: Broadens definition of "employee" to include assistants/technologists providing direct medical care to patients and allows union/association to file appeal to personnel appeal board.

740.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
740.title: Renewable Energy Standards
740.description: Authorizes the establishment of a thermal energy standard which promotes the development of thermal renewable energy technologies.

744.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
744.title: The Green Buildings Act
744.description: Expands the "Green Buildings Act" to include public projects and updates the standards to include LEED for Neighborhood Development, and SITES.

745.title: Municipal Retirement - Retirement System Membership
745.description: Places the current Cranston police chief in a defined contribution retirement plan.

746.title: Micro Businesses
746.description: Supports participation of micro businesses in the economic activity in the state, including state-directed public construction projects and in-state purchases. It requires DOA to compile data and submit an annual report to the governor/general assembly.

748.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
748.title: Child Care--state Subsidies
748.description: Enhances the reimbursement rates for infants and toddlers enrolled in licensed child care centers and family child care homes that have achieved a quality rating of 2 to 5 stars in Bright Stars, the state's quality rating system.

752.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
752.title: Correctional Institutions - Loss Of Rights By Prisoners
752.description: Provides that any person serving life in prison, will have the right to get married and the status of being civilly dead for life prisoners, would not apply to the bond of matrimony.

755.title: Courts - Court Administration
755.description: Removes the 30 day mail notice requirement to those owing overdue court fees currently received prior to their names being published.

757.title: Unclaimed Intangible And Tangible Property
757.description: Specifies the procedure for the escheat of unclaimed United States savings bonds.

758.last_action: Committee recommends passage of Sub A in concurrence
758.title: Land Development And Subdivision Review--unified Development Review
758.description: Provides for unified development review by local zoning/planning boards/commissions for major/minor land developments/subdivisions.

761.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
761.title: Electricians - Trades Licensing - Penalty For Violations
761.description: Each individual violating law governing electricians, plumbers, and other trades constitutes a separate offense for firms/corporations.

763.title: Accountancy
763.description: Amends certain provisions of the general laws governing the licensing of accountants to eliminate outmoded, inconsistent and unnecessary regulations.

764.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
764.title: Office Of Health And Human Services
764.description: Requires the Executive Office of Health and Human Services ("EOHHS") to create a critical prescription drug list and requires financial disclosure by drug manufacturers.

765.title: Regulatory Oversight
765.description: Provides that electronic money transfers include transactions of virtual currency and would amend the provisions on notices in connection with the voluntary restructuring of solvent insurers to eliminate the requirement of first class mail.

766.title: Gaming And Athletics Licensing
766.description: Changes the title of the "division of racing and athletics" to the "division of gaming and athletics licensing".

767.title: Corporate Governances
767.description: Requires insurance companies to annually file the director of business regulation a corporate governance disclosure form which contains a summary of the carriers structure, policies and practices.

768.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
768.title: Motor Vehicle Dealer Sales Act
768.description: Regulates motor vehicle dealerships in the conduct of the business of insurance.

769.title: Engineers
769.description: Amends statutes governing engineers, land surveyors and landscape architects (design professionals) to eliminate outmoded regulations and to allow online applications filing for certificate of authorization for design professionals.

770.title: Relating To Education-compulsory Attendance
770.description: Broadens the law on compulsory school attendance so that it would apply to all children enrolled in kindergarten.

771.title: Relating To Public Utilities And Carriers-duties Of Utilities And Carriers
771.description: Defines the group eligible for restoration of electric and/or gas service consistently with the current LIHEAP State Plan for Rhode Island filed with the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services.

772.title: Uniformed Controlled Substance Act
772.description: Authorizes any vendor, agent, contractor, or designee who operates an electronic medical health record (EMR) or clinical management system to have access to the prescription drug monitoring program (PDMP).

773.title: Administration Of State Institutions
773.description: Repeals an outdated statute providing for the care and physical welfare of inmates, prisoners, parents and pupils in the institutions under the control of the department of human services.

776.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
776.title: Divorce And Separation
776.description: Authorizes a judge of the family court to consider the wishes of a minor in making determinations regarding custody and visitation, provided the minor is of sufficient age and has the capacity to reason.

779.title: Employment Security -- Confidential Information
779.description: Allows the director of DLT to release confidential information and documents to the department of corrections solely for the purpose of case management and post-release supervision.

781.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
781.title: Relating To Criminal Procedure-expungement Of Criminal Records
781.description: Makes all criminal records, despite expungement, available to the department of children, youth and families, for any individual seeking certification as a child care or youth serving agency worker pursuant to §40-13.2 et seq.

782.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
782.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses
782.description: Prohibits the department of motor vehicles from issuing or renewing any operator's license when the applicant fails to provide a valid social security number unless provides proof presence authorized under federal law as legal permanent resident.

787.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
787.title: Relating Education -- Board Of Governors For Higher Education
787.description: Requires the council on postsecondary education to develop policies for all public colleges to maintain an office to assist students with disabilities in aspects of academic, social, living, and career-planning in the post-secondary education setting.

788.title: Alcohol And/or Drug Use Amnesty For Reporters Of Violence At Institutions Of Higher Education
788.description: Requires institutions of higher learning to adopt a policy which grants amnesty for violations of drug/alcohol policies for those who report incidents of violence, including domestic violence, dating violence, stalking and sexual assault.

789.title: The Rhode Island Health Information Exchange Act Of 2008
789.description: Permits specifically designated and authorized persons to access the confidential health care information of the designating individual from the health information exchange.

790.title: Relating To Corporations, Associations, And Partnerships
790.description: Amends the statutes regarding securities and franchises in order to allow for electronic filings and to remove the filing fee for advertising.

791.title: Commercial Water Filtration/treatment System Contractors
791.description: Establishes limited licenses for commercial water filtration/treatment system work to be governed under the authority of the board of examiners of plumbers.

792.title: Rhode Island Well Drilling Contractors Licensing Law
792.description: Gives the contractor's registration and licensing board jurisdiction over pump installers and residential water filtration/treatment system contractors.

794.title: Taxicabs And Limited Public Motor Vehicles
794.description: Permits private cause of action by taxicab certificate holders against violations of the law or rules governing taxicab regulation.

799.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
799.title: Public Motor Vehicle
799.description: Requires the division of public utilities and carriers to impose a moratorium on the issuance of all new certificates authorizing the operation of public motor vehicles until June 30, 2017.

803.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
803.title: Health Care Accessibility And Quality Assurance Act
803.description: Requires health care facilities to use licensed Rhode Island Nurses to satisfy staffing needs.

804.title: State Lottery--disbursement Of Revenue
804.description: Directs profits from the state lottery into a restricted receipt account to be disbursed as state aid to education.

805.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
805.title: University Of Rhode Island Innovation Campus
805.description: Authorizes a referendum to be submitted at the November 2016 election which would authorize the issuance of twenty million dollars ($20,000,000) in bonds to develop an innovation campus at the University of Rhode Island.

806.title: Emergency Shelters
806.description: Establishes rules and procedures for licensing emergency shelters including setting minimum standards and prohibiting the charging fees to the residents.

810.title: The Naming Of State Constructions - East Bay Bike Path
810.description: Clarifies that the entirety of the east bay bike path is named in honor of Thomas Byrnes.

812.title: Apprenticeship Programs In Trade And Industry
812.description: Repeals the apprenticeship program fee which shall be paid by each program sponsor and it would also repeal the apprenticeship registration fee which shall be paid by each indentured apprentice.

813.title: Governor's Workforce Board
813.description: Requires the state career pathways system of the workforce board to create pathways and workforce training programs to fill skill gaps and employment opportunities in the clean energy sector.

817.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
817.title: Biodiesel Heating Oil Act Of 2013
817.description: Adds a definition for "fuel oil terminal" and establish procedures for obtaining temporary suspensions from compliance when there is an inadequate supply of biobased product or when good cause is shown.

818.title: Licenses
818.description: Facilitates the issuance of hunting licenses by Internet application.

819.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
819.title: Producer Responsibility Program For Printed Paper And Packaging
819.description: Establishes a producer responsibility program for printed paper and packaging.

820.title: The Healing Art Of Acupuncture And Oriental Medicine
820.description: Establishes 5 member acupuncture/Oriental medicine board within health department and provides for removal of members for unprofessional conduct.

821.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
821.title: Establishment Of Regional School Districts - Chariho Career And Technical Center
821.description: Provides department of education shall not approve a new career and technical program or center in certain towns so long as a center is maintained by the Chariho regional school district.

823.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
823.title: Corrections Department
823.description: Provides inmates who are on work release reimburse the state for costs of confinement by paying no less than thirty percent (30%) of their net salary for room and board.

825.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
825.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--procedure In Particular Actions
825.description: Establishes the uniform commercial receivership act, in order to provide uniformity with respect to the powers, rights, and duties of receivers appointed over commercial property.

832.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
832.title: Governor's Commerce And Workforce Coordination Cabinet
832.description: Eliminates the council of economic advisors, the governor's commerce and workforce coordination cabinet, and would correct references in the executive office of commerce enabling act.

833.title: Rhode Island Underground Storage Tank Financial Responsibility Act
833.description: Renames the Rhode Island storage tank financial responsibility review board to the Rhode Island storage tank financial responsibility advisory board and claims process and oversight of the underground storage tank fund.

834.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
834.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists And Estheticians
834.description: Defines the practice of natural hair braiding and exempts the practice from regulations regarding licensing.

835.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
835.title: Rhode Island Food, Drugs, And Cosmetics Act
835.description: Requires manufacturers to fully disclose all ingredients of their cosmetics on their product label, as well as on their website. Failure to do so would result in a substantial fine.

837.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
837.title: Fantasy Contest Registration
837.description: Establishes a process by which the operators of fantasy contest businesses are to be registered and regulated.

841.title: Pharmacy Freedom Of Choice - Fair Competition And Practices
841.description: Adds a ($1.00) fee per covered life per month to be paid when filing the annual report required of third party administrators of pharmacy benefit plans. The funds will go into a restricted receipt account and would be spent on opioid disorders.

842.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
842.title: Relating To Taxation-historic Preservation Tax Credits 2013
842.description: Repeals the sunset provision of chapter 33.6 of title 44 which grants tax credits to individuals or companies redeveloping historic structures.

844.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
844.title: Drinking Water Supply System Protection
844.description: Classifies the two (2) types of water quality protection funds and provides for the administration of the funds deposited therein.

845.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
845.title: Public Drinking Water Supply System Protection
845.description: Makes changes in the procedure for the remittance and disbursement of water charges and would provide that upon dissolution of the water resources board, charges would be maintained by each supplier to support water quality protection programs.

847.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
847.title: Temporary Disability Insurance
847.description: Expands TDI benefits, change the calculation of the taxable wage base; to state and municipal employees; increases the maximum number of weeks an employee can collect TDI and TCI; and expands TCI benefits for the care of siblings and grandchildren.

848.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
848.title: Drug Coverage
848.description: Requires health insurers to notify pharmacies and subscribers at least sixty days in advance of removing any prescription drug from its plan formulary.

849.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
849.title: Insurance Coverage For Mental Health And Substance Abuse Disorders
849.description: Defines coinsurance and prohibits insurance contracts or policies from using coinsurance to calculate and collect additional funds from patients, including mental health and substance abuse patients.

853.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
853.title: Tax Credits
853.description: Enhances the reporting requirements related to the transfer or conveyance of transferable tax credits.

854.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
854.title: Public Transit-- Powers And Duties Of The Authority
854.description: Removes the Rhode Island Transit Authority's bus fare adjustments enacted in fiscal year 2016 budget.

855.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
855.title: Fantasy Contests
855.description: Establishes the "Fantasy Contest Act" which imposes various consumer protection practices upon fantasy contest operators and requires them to register with the department of business regulation.

856.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
856.title: Grandparents Rights
856.description: Specifies that relevant factors which should be considered by the family court when granting grandparents visitation rights.

858.title: Fire Safety
858.description: Makes several updates to the state fire code and its reference to the term and adoption of portions of the national fire codes.

859.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies--eating Disorders
859.description: Requires health insurance providers to provide coverage for eating disorders and would apply to nonprofit hospital service corporations, nonprofit medical service corporations and health maintenance organizations.

860.title: Collaborative Pharmacy Practice
860.description: Expands the number of pharmacists eligible to engage in collaborative pharmacy practice with physicians by including all licensed pharmacists and provides for biennial review of collaborative practice agreements.

861.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
861.title: Street Lights On State Roads
861.description: Provides that the cost to operate all lighting equipment located on state roads would be the responsibility of the state and not the municipality where the lighting equipment is located.

863.title: Liquor Control Administration
863.description: Clarifies certain sections dealing with alcoholic beverage licenses and enforcement and grants Providence the right to establish certain new liquor licenses and regulate live entertainment.

865.title: Property Subject To Taxation--town Of Exeter
865.description: Authorizes the town of Exeter to enter into tax stabilization agreements, including agreements for payments in lieu of taxes with respect to renewable energy facilities.

866.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
866.title: Relating To Business Regulations
866.description: Amends various statutes in connection with the administrative powers of the department of business regulation in order to provide consistency with respect to the penalty – related provisions governing the businesses subject to the statutes.

868.title: Wardens And Supervisors
868.description: Updates many of the voting administrative laws to reflect the current election practices, procedures and use of the new voting equipment, including the use of electronic voting lists.

869.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
869.title: General Regulatory Provisions - Uniform Fraudulent Transfer Act
869.description: Amends the "Uniform Fraudulent Transfer Act" to be called the "Uniform Voidable Transfer Act" and amends several provisions to the general laws to reflect this change.

871.title: Authorizing The Town Of East Greenwich To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Rehabilitation, Repair, Improvement And Landscaping Of Roads, Sidewalks And Drainage Facilities In The Town, And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto Including, But Not Limited To, Engineering Costs And Approving The Issuance Of Bonds And Notes Therefor In An Amount Not To Exceed $5,000,000
871.description: Authorizes the town of East Greenwich to issue not more than $5,000,000 bonds and notes to finance the construction, renovation, rehabilitation, repair, improvement, and landscaping of roads, sidewalks and drainage facilities in the town.

872.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
872.title: The Rhode Island Bridge Replacement, Reconstruction And Maintenance Fund
872.description: Requires that toll rates and the location of tolling facilities be approved by the general assembly prior to the collection of any tolls or the construction of any tolling facilities.

873.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
873.title: Funding Of Charter Public Schools
873.description: Reduces a local school district's quarterly per pupil payments to charter schools whose teachers to not participate in either the state or a municipal pension system.

874.title: Commercial Fishing License Review Board
874.description: Repeals the section which created the commercial fishing license review board.

876.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
876.title: Access To Public Records
876.description: Revises access to public records charter re: definitions of public body public record, right to inspect, copy records, arrest logs, compliance, costs, court jurisdiction, remedies, claims settlement, violations.

877.title: Local Real Estate Assessments
877.description: Allows the town of Bristol to postpone its full real estate revaluation update from 2016 to 2019.

879.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
879.title: Child Products And Upholstered Furniture
879.description: Prohibits the manufacture, sale, and distribution of residential upholstered children's products that contain certain amounts of bromide or chlorine bonded to carbon that is added to a plastic, foam, or textile.

880.title: Instruction For Deaf Or Hard-of-hearing Students
880.description: Requires state department of elementary and secondary education to ensure the development of language skills for all deaf and hard-of-hearing students.

881.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
881.title: Equal Rights Of Blind And Deaf Persons To Public Facilities
881.description: Requires movie theaters to provide open captioning for persons who are deaf or hard-of-hearing.

882.title: Rhode Island Livable Home Tax Credit Act
882.description: Establishes livable home tax credit granting credits for new resident purchases, retrofitting of existing residence, administered by Rhode Island Housing and Mortgage Finance Corporation.

885.title: Teaching After Retirement
885.description: Allows retired members of the state retirement system who are certified as substitute teachers to substitute teach not more than ninety (90) days a year without reduction in retirement benefits.

886.title: Real Estate Conveyance Tax
886.description: Exempts from the real estate conveyance tax the transfer of interests in any housing development financed in whole or in part by federal low income housing tax credits.

889.title: Traffic Safety Education
889.description: Requires state board of education approval for driver education courses for new drivers.

890.title: City Housing Authorities
890.description: Increases the quorum requirement for the Woonsocket Housing Authority from three to four.

891.title: Retired State Employees Medical Benefits
891.description: Releases retired state employees who receive medical insurance from paying a deductible or co-payment for any covered medical expenses for 5 years.

892.title: Authorizing The Town Of Middletown To Finance Health, Safety And Fire-code Related Repairs, Alterations, Renovations, Improvements And Equipping Of School Facilities In The Town And All Attendant Expenses And By The Issuance Of Not More Than $10,000,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes Or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor
892.description: Authorizes the town of Middletown to issue not more than $10,000,000 general obligation bonds/notes/other evidences of indebtedness to finance health/safety/fire-code related repairs, alterations, renovations, improvements/ equipping of school facilities.

893.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Kingstown To Finance A Community Septic System Loan Program And To Issue Not More Than $2,000,000 Notes Therefor
893.description: Authorizes the town of North Kingstown to finance a community septic system loan program.

894.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
894.title: Residential Renewable Energy System Tax Credit
894.description: Allows those individuals who pay part or all of the cost of a renewable energy system to carry over the tax credit, if not used for the year of installation, to the next year for a maximum of 3 years.

898.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
898.title: Bail And Recognizance
898.description: Upon defendant's violation of terms of bail, the amount forfeited by court is limited to 10% of surety deposited. Bondsperson has extra time to return fugitive before further forfeiture. If fugitive isn't returned, there is forfeiture.

902.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
902.title: Opticians
902.description: Prohibits the dispensing of contact lenses without a valid prescription and would mandate that prescriptions expire one year after issuance unless a shorter time is necessary based on the medical judgment of the optometrist.

903.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
903.title: Related To Insurance - Surprise Bills For Medical Services
903.description: Provides for a dispute resolution process for emergency services and surprise bills for medical services performed by nonparticipating (out-of-network) health care providers.

905.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
905.title: Community Requirements - Adequate Minimum Budget Provision
905.description: Provides that any non-recurring capital expenses shall not be included in the annual budget or in the maintenance of effort of any school district.

906.title: Dorian J. Murray Foundation License Plate
906.description: Authorizes the creation of a special license plate for the Dorian J. Murray Foundation. Revenue generated would be split between the foundation and the state.

907.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
907.title: Blackstone Valley Economic Revitalization Act Of 2016
907.description: Appropriates ten million dollars ($10,000,000) into a restricted account at the department of transportation known as the Pawtucket and Central Falls commuter rail station fund.

911.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
911.title: Civil Procedure - Courts - Judicial Selection
911.description: Authorizes chief judge to appoint judicial candidates if governor fails to fill a vacancy within the required 21 days, and extends list of eligible candidates as of 3/31/13 until 3/31/18.

912.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
912.title: Judicial Selection
912.description: Requires that when a judge of color on a state court leaves the bench, they would be replaced by a person of color.

916.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
916.title: Accident And Sickness Insurance Policies - Step Therapy Protocol
916.description: Allows for a step therapy exception determination when coverage of a prescription drug for the treatment of a medical condition is restricted for use by an insurer, health plan, or utilization review organization.

917.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
917.title: Assaults
917.description: Includes members of the United States Armed Forces in criminal offenses against police offers and officials.

921.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
921.title: Seafood - Sales
921.description: Requires that all seafood offered for sale in Rhode Island bear a label that indicates whether it is farm raised or wild.

923.title: Employment Of Veterans
923.description: Expands the restoration of employment rights of employees who are members of the National Guard of this or any other state.

924.title: Employment Rights Of Members Of Armed Forces
924.description: Protects jobs of National Guard members of any state who work in Rhode Island and allows private employers to adopt a veterans preference.

925.title: Developmental Disabilities Ombudsperson Act Of 2016
925.description: Creates a developmental disabilities ombudsman program to be attached to the department of administration. The ombudsman would advocate for developmentally disabled adults and would be selected by the governor from a list of 3-5 candidates.

926.title: Transportation Network Company Services
926.description: Creates a comprehensive regulatory scheme for motor vehicle passenger services provided by transportation network companies which use digital network as software application services to connect passengers to transportation providers.

928.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
928.title: Victim's Rights
928.description: Provides that a motor vehicle accident with death resulting, if the attorney general decides not to prosecute a criminal case, the attorney general shall give the decedent's representatives an opportunity to discuss why the matter is not being prosecuted.

931.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
931.title: Definitions And General Code Provisions
931.description: Allows applicant to obtain "year of manufacture plate" from DMV/receive approval to display plate in possession on vehicle more than 25 years old.

932.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
932.title: Academic Credit For Participation In Rotc
932.description: Requires the council on elementary and secondary education to develop policy or regulations regarding academic credit for high school ROTC participation.

933.title: State Retirement Benefits And Contributions
933.description: Effective July 1, 2016, this act would transfer several classes of state public safety professionals from the state retirement system to the municipal employee retirement system.

934.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
934.title: Indebtedness Of Towns And Cities - Study Of Consolidation
934.description: Requires the prior approval of the municipal finance division of the department of administration for the issuance of bonded indebtedness by the towns and cities in the state.

935.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
935.title: Indebtedness Of Towns And Cities--study Of Consolidation
935.description: Directs the department of administration to study using the bonding authority of the state to consolidate the bonded indebtedness of the towns and cities.

938.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
938.title: The Rhode Island Works Program
938.description: Amends the eligibility period for cash assistance under the Rhode Island Works Program.

939.title: Taxation Of Insurance Companies
939.description: Establishes a procedure to consider a reduction of the premium tax rate for qualifying insurers that have added new, full-time qualifying jobs in this state.

940.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
940.title: Organic Certification Program
940.description: Requires DEM to continue to promote and operate with appropriate staffing the organic certification program, with the general assembly to provide the necessary funding.

943.title: Courts - Judicial Administration
943.description: Provides in all civil cases where an order is issued for court fines, costs, or fees, which remain unpaid, the court shall schedule a review hearing within 2 years. If more than 2 years have elapsed any amount owed shall be waived and discharged.

945.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
945.title: Park And Ride Lots
945.description: Prohibits commercial vehicles from using park and ride lots to transport passengers to out-of-state casinos.

947.title: Department Of Children, Youth And Families
947.description: Makes hearings on child abuse or neglect cases open to the public. It would also provide that the director of DCYF disclose findings and facts of investigations when there is a fatality or near fatality of a child.

950.title: Authorizing The Chariho Regional School District To Finance The Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Building For The R.y.s.e. School, Including Removal Of Existing Modular Classrooms And To Finance Improvements To The Switch Road Campus, Including, But Not Limited To, Landscaping, Paving, Parking And Traffic Redesign And All Expenses Incidental Thereto By The Issuance Of Not More Than $6,000,000 Bonds And/or Notes Therefor, Subject To Approval Of State School Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Of Not Less Than 56%
950.description: A $6,000,000 bond bill which authorizes the Chariho Regional School District to finance the construction/furnishing/equipping of a new building for R.Y.S.E. school, and the removal of existing modular classrooms/improvements to the Switch Rd Campus.

951.title: Farmland Preservation Act
951.description: Allows agricultural lands preservation commission to resell land without being subject to the first right to purchase by the municipality.

953.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
953.title: Nurse Licensure Compact
953.description: Makes a number of changes to the licensure requirements of the nurse licensure compact, and would establish an interstate commission of nurse licensure compact administrators and define its powers and duties.

954.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Of The Charter Of Berard-desjarlais Post 88 Club
954.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Of The Charter Of Berard-desjarlais Post 88 Club

955.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Veterans' Exemptions
955.description: Creates a property tax exemption of up to $250,000 and for totally disabled veterans residing in the city of Cranston and would also apply to any surviving spouse of that veteran.

956.title: School Closings
956.description: Grants to each individual municipal school departments the power to determine whether their schedules would be open on a particular scheduled election day.

957.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
957.title: Public Beach Smoking Pollution Control Act
957.description: Prohibits smoking on public beaches in the state of Rhode Island.

958.title: Operators' And Chauffeurs' Licenses - School Bus Driver Annual Training
958.description: Requires that school bus drivers' annual training include the National Highway Traffic Safety Administration's school bus driver in-service training series.

959.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Finance The Construction, Improvement, Renovation, Repair, Alteration, Furnishing And Equipping Of Public Buildings In The City By The Issuance Of Not More Than $1,000,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes Therefor
959.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds and temporary notes for the construction, improvement, renovation, repair, alteration, furnishing and equipping of public buildings in the city.

963.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Finance The Acquisition, Improvement, Renovation And Repair Of Fire And Public Safety Equipment By The Issuance Of Not More Than $4,000,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes Therefor
963.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue not more than Four Million Dollars ($4,000,000) general obligation bonds and temporary notes for the acquisition, improvement, renovation and repair of fire and public safety equipment.

964.title: Authorizing The City Of Cranston To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Rehabilitation, Repair, Improvement And Landscaping Of Roads, Sidewalks And Drainage Facilities In The City And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto Including, But Not Limited To, Engineering Costs By The Issuance Of Not More Than $20,000,000 General Obligation Bonds And Notes Therefor
964.description: Authorizes the city of Cranston to issue not more than $20,000,000 general obligation bonds and temporary notes for the construction, renovation, rehabilitation, repair, improvement and landscaping of roads, sidewalks and drainage facilities.

965.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
965.title: Railroad Preservation
965.description: Suspends any payments due to MBTA or its operating subcontractor Kiolus for so long as either is in default on the operating agreement.

966.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of N E F L, Inc.
966.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of N E F L, Inc.

968.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
968.title: Local Planning Board Or Commission
968.description: Requires that members of local planning boards and commission receive two (2) hours of training on issues related to development in flood plains and the effects of sea level rise once every two (2) years.

977.title: Public Preparatory Academy
977.description: Authorizes the cities of Providence and Central Falls to create an alternative academy for students having difficulty in traditional public school settings.

979.title: Retirement System - Contribution And Benefits
979.description: Increases the maximum post retirement employment earnings from $15,000 to $18,000 a year for retired educators who provide instruction at state colleges.

981.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
981.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Charlestown
981.description: Authorizes the Charlestown town council to exempt from taxation tangible business property in whole or in part located in that town.

983.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
983.title: Relating To Probate Practice And Procedure Revised Uniform Fiduciary Access To Digital Assets Act
983.description: 2016) (Regulates fiduciary designated recipient access to digital assets relating to probate practice and procedure by creating a uniform act to conform to law of other adopting states.

985.title: Lead And Copper Drinking Water Protection Act
985.description: Directs the department of health to use funds from federal capitalization grants to conduct baseline copper and lead testing the water supply systems of each local government as well as in public schools and licensed daycare facilities.

986.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Improvement And Replacement Of Road Safety Improvements And Traffic Control Devices In The City Of Pawtucket And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
986.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds to finance improvements and replacement of road safety improvements and traffic control devices in the city and all costs related thereto.

987.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Rehabilitation, Construction, Renovation And Improvement Of The City Hall Tower And All Costs Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $5,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
987.description: Authorizes Pawtucket to issue not more than $5,000,000 in bonds to finance the rehabilitation of the City Hall Tower.

988.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Construction, Renovation And Improvement, Repair, Alteration, Furnishing And Equipping Of Public Buildings In The City And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,600,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
988.description: Authorizes Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,600,000 of indebtedness to finance improvement, construction, and equipping of its public buildings for fiscal years 2018/2019 upon approval of electors.

989.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Renovation, Construction, Reconstruction And Equipping Of Public Recreation Facilities In The City And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $2,500,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
989.description: Authorizes city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $2,500,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance renovation/construction/ reconstruction & equipping of public recreation facilities & all costs related thereto.

990.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Design, Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Streets And Sidewalks Including, But Not Limited To, Drainage And Landscaping And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,000,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
990.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,000,000 general obligation bonds to finance design, construction, reconstruction and repair of streets and sidewalks including drainage and landscaping and all costs related thereto.

991.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For Construction And Reconstruction Of The Sewer And Sanitation System In The City Including A Comprehensive Sewer System Evaluation Study And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $1,600,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
991.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $1,600,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction and reconstruction of the sewer and sanitation system.

992.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Provide For The Construction, Reconstruction And Repair Of Bridges And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto And Authorizing The Financing Thereof, Including The Issue Of Not More Than $300,000 Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
992.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $300,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, reconstruction and repair of bridges.

993.title: Authorizing The City Of Pawtucket To Issue Not More Than $24,000,000 General Obligation Bonds, Notes And Other Evidences Of Indebtedness To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Improvement, Alteration, Repair, Furnishing And Equipping Of Schools And School Facilities Throughout The City, To Fund The Capital Improvement Program For The Two Fiscal Years 2018 And 2019
993.description: Authorizes the city of Pawtucket to issue not more than $24,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the construction, renovation, improvement, alteration, repair, furnishing and equipping of schools.

994.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
994.title: State Construction Projects Metrics
994.description: Requires that the division of planning create a checklist of environmental and energy issues that certain state construction projects which cost in excess of ten million dollars ($10,000,000) would need to consider and address.

995.title: Property Subject To Taxation -- Veterans' And Elderly Exemptions -- West Warwick
995.description: Enables the West Warwick town council, by ordinance, to increase the veterans' and elderly tax exemptions from one hundred seventy dollars ($170) up to ten thousand dollars ($10,000).

996.title: Property Subject To Taxation--lucy's Hearth
996.description: Exempts from taxation the real and personal property located within the town of Middletown of Lucy's Hearth, a Rhode Island nonprofit corporation.

999.title: Agriculture Functions Of Department Of Environmental Management
999.description: Extends by six (6) months, the deadline for the department of environmental management and the coastal resources management council to promulgate standards for freshwater wetland buffers and setbacks into state rules and regulations.

1001.title: Authorizing The Town Of Bristol To Finance The Design, Engineering And Construction Of Capital Improvement Projects Including, Without Limitation, Drainage, Road And Sidewalk Repairs And Improvements, Additions And Renovations To Public Buildings And Town-owned Marina, Acquisition Of Open Space, And The Acquiring Of Equipment In Connection Therewith By Issuance Of Not More Than $17,000,000 Bonds Therefor
1001.description: Authorizes the town of Bristol to issue not more than $17,000,000 general obligation bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the design, engineering and construction of certain capital improvement projects.

1002.title: Authorizing The Town Of North Providence To Issue Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not Exceeding $75,000,000 To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Rehabilitation, Repair, Improvements, Furnishing And Equipping Of And/or Additions To Schools And School Facilities In The Town Including, But Not Limited To, The Construction Of Two New Elementary Schools And Health And Safety Improvements To Elementary Schools, Middle Schools And The High School
1002.description: Authorizes North Providence to issue bonds and notes not exceeding $75,000,000 for construction, renovating, equipping of schools upon approval of its electors.

1003.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1003.title: Municipal Employees - Retirement
1003.description: Permits certain Cranston fire department union employees to enroll in a defined contribution plan.

1004.title: Authorizing The Town Of Westerly To Issue Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not Exceeding $38,500,000 To Finance The Construction, Renovation, Rehabilitation, Repair, Improvements, Furnishing And Equipping Of And/or Additions To Schools And School Facilities In The Town
1004.description: Authorizes the Town of Westerly to issue bonds and notes in an amount not exceeding $38,500,000 to finance the construction, renovation, rehabilitation, repair, improvements, furnishing and equipping of and/or additions to schools and school facilities.

1007.title: Duties And Utilities And Carriers
1007.description: Authorizes the department of human services to use low-income energy assistance funds throughout the calendar year, establish an arrearage program and require the PUC to conduct a review of programs impacting low-income ratepayers.

1008.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Iglesia Pentecostal El Calvario
1008.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Iglesia Pentecostal El Calvario

1009.title: Federal Secure And Fair Enforcement For Mortgage Licensing
1009.description: Corrects a technical error in the penalty provision of the act adopting the Federal Secure and Fair Enforcement for Mortgage Licensing Act of 2009.

1012.title: Property Subject To Taxation--tides Family Services, Inc.
1012.description: Exempts from taxation the real and personal property located within the town of West Warwick of Tides Family Services, Inc., a Rhode Island nonprofit corporation.

1014.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1014.title: Official Court Interpreters
1014.description: Extends the privileged nature of communications to interpreters of that communications as long as the interpreters are officially working for the state office of court interpreters.

1015.title: Batterers Intervention Programs And Probation Supervision
1015.description: Creates a batterer’s intervention program fund and also adopts evidence-based probation and parole supervision systems.

1016.title: Relating To Courts And Civil Procedure--courts--superior Court Diversion
1016.description: Creates superior court diversion program, imposing certain service and screening conditions on defendants in return for exoneration of charges.

1019.title: Biliteracy Seal
1019.description: Establishes a state seal of biliteracy to recognize high school graduates who have attained a high level of proficiency in listening, speaking, reading, and writing in one or more languages in addition to English.

1020.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1020.title: Relating To The Merger Of The Lonsdale Fire District Into The Saylesville Fire District
1020.description: Authorizes the merger of the Lonsdale and Saylesville Fire Districts in Lincoln if the electors of both fire districts approve that merger.

1021.title: Rhode Island Regulatory Reform Act
1021.description: Establishes an office of regulatory reform task force to make recommendations for a statewide solar permitting process.

1022.title: Counties - Blackstone River
1022.description: Renames the Seekonk River as forming a part of the Blackstone River.

1023.title: Authorizing The Town Of Narragansett To Finance The Acquisition And Renovation Of Real Estate And/or Interests Or Rights Therein And Related Equipment For A Library And To Issue Not More Than $5,800,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor
1023.description: Authorizes the town of Narragansett to finance the acquisition and renovation of real estate and related equipment for a library and to issue bonds and notes in an amount not to exceed $5,800,000.

1026.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1026.title: Prompt Payment To State Contractors
1026.description: Requires state contractors, that are paid by the state, to pay monthly interest to its subcontractors that it had not timely paid.

1028.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1028.title: Safe Harbor For Sexually Exploited Children
1028.description: Permits minor victims of sex trafficking to seek compensation under the criminal injuries compensation act and would establish immunity from prosecution, for sexually exploited children and require sexually exploited children to be reported to DCYF.

1029.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1029.title: Moving Violations
1029.description: Increases the fine motorists pay for not driving reasonable and prudent speeds, emergency break-down lane travel, and right-of-way violations, if the violation caused bodily injury to someone other than themselves.

1030.title: Contractors' Bonds
1030.description: Expands the penalties which public works contractors can be assessed for failing to properly pay persons for the services they provide to them.

1032.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of W.d. Schock Co., Inc.
1032.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of W.d. Schock Co., Inc.

1033.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Jamestown Estates Homeowner's Association
1033.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Jamestown Estates Homeowner's Association

1035.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1035.title: Psychologists
1035.description: Includes licensed school psychologists under the provisions of the general laws governing the regulations of psychologists.

1038.title: Workers' Compensation Court
1038.description: Makes changes to the workers' compensation laws including increasing daily pay for members of the medical advisory board and changing the mileage rate that work-injured employees receive when they attend medical exams and rehabilitation, to the IRS rate.

1040.title: Sentence And Execution
1040.description: Makes several changes to the sentencing and execution guidelines for purposes of criminal procedure and would add new conditions of criminal probation.

1041.title: Foster Parents' Bill Of Rights
1041.description: Establishes a formal statement of foster parents' bill of rights, and requires that copies be given to all foster parents upon licensing and at each licensing interval.

1045.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1045.title: Mayoral Academies
1045.description: Requires the approval of the town council and school committee of North Smithfield for the establishment of a mayoral academy drawing on North Smithfield, or for the enrollment of any additional North Smithfield students at RISE Mayoral Academy.

1046.title: Authorizing The Town Of Warren To Finance The Maintenance And Construction Of Sewers And Sewerage Systems In The Town By The Issuance Of Not More Than $20,000,000 Bonds And/or Notes Therefor Including, But Not Limited To, Any Bonds Or Notes Issued Pursuant To Financing Agreements With The Rhode Island Infrastructure Bank
1046.description: Authorizes the Town of Warren to issue not more than $20,000,000 bonds and notes to finance the maintenance and construction of sewers and sewerage systems.

1047.title: Authorizing The Town Of Coventry To Finance The Rehabilitation Of The Existing Human Services Building Including Construction Of An Addition Thereto For Reuse As A Police Station/human Services Complex And All Costs Incidental Or Related Thereto Including Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Thereof, By The Issuance Of Not More Than $12,000,000 Bonds And/or Notes Therefor
1047.description: Authorizes the town of Coventry to issue up to twenty million dollars in bonds and notes to finance rehabilitation of town buildings.

1048.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1048.title: Termination Of Employment Contracts
1048.description: Reduces the period of time that a state employee, under contract, could receive benefits (including salary) after termination from six (6) months to two (2) weeks and would also reduce maximum severance pay from one year to two (2) weeks.

1049.title: To Incorporate The Wesquage Community District
1049.description: To Incorporate The Wesquage Community District

1052.title: Uniform Controlled Substances Act--regulation Of Manufacturing, Distributing, Prescribing, Administering, And Dispensing Controlled Substances
1052.description: Requires pharmacies to transmit prescription information to the prescription monitoring data base within twenty-four hours of dispensing an opioid. Provides limits on amounts of opoids to be prescribed.

1053.title: Authorizing The Town Of Tiverton To Issue General Obligation Bonds And Notes In An Amount Not To Exceed $15,438,230 To Finance Replacement Of Roofs And Hvac Systems At The Tiverton Middle School And The Tiverton High School
1053.description: Authorizes the town of Tiverton to issue not more than $15,438,230 bonds and notes to finance replacement of roofs and HVAC systems at the Tiverton Middle School and the Tiverton High School.

1054.title: Authorizing The Town Of Barrington To Finance The Acquisition, Construction, Furnishing And Equipping Of A New Middle School And All Expenses Incident Thereto, Including, But Not Limited To, Costs Of Design, Demolition, Athletic Fields, Landscaping And Parking By The Issuance Of Not More Than $68,400,000 Bonds, Notes And/or Other Evidences Of Indebtedness Therefor, Subject To Approval Of State Housing Aid At A Reimbursement Rate Of Not Less Than 35% For Expenditures Eligible For Reimbursement
1054.description: Authorizes the town of Barrington to issue not more than $68,400,000 bonds, notes and other evidences of indebtedness to finance the acquisition, construction, furnishing and equipping of a New Middle School and all expenses incident thereto.

1055.title: Motor Fuel Tax
1055.description: Adds propane to the definition of fuels for tax purposes but not propane used for a purpose other than the operation or propulsion of motor vehicles.

1057.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1057.title: Renaming The Albion Bridge The Gordon R. Archibald Memorial Bridge
1057.description: Renames the Albion Bridge in the City of Warwick the Gordon R. Archibald Memorial Bridge.

1058.title: Correctional Institutions - Parole, Medical Parole, Community Confinement, And Correctional Impacts
1058.description: Amends the provisions of the general laws pertaining to parole, medical parole, community confinement, and replaces prison impact statements with correctional impact statements.

1059.title: Relating To Agriculture And Forestry
1059.description: Permits the growth of hemp by properly licensed individuals that have applied and met the requirements of this chapter.

1060.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Vermette Bros., Inc.
1060.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Vermette Bros., Inc.

1061.title: Self-service Storage Facilities
1061.description: Eliminates the requirement that the owner of a self-storage facility, in the absence of personal service upon any occupant who has defaulted, notify the occupant of the default and the owner's enforcement of its lien by publication.

1063.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1063.title: Abused And Neglected Children
1063.description: Requires non-emergency child placements by DCYF to include in the petition for placement investigations of both paternal and maternal families.

1064.title: Energy Facility Siting Act
1064.description: Increases the membership of the energy facility siting board from three (3) to seven (7) members, and requires approval by the electors in Burrillville of any tax agreement established by the town council with a power plant located in the town.

1065.title: Radiologic Technologists
1065.description: Establishes a continuing education requirement for renewal of those radiologic technologists (radiographers) initially licensed prior to December 10, 2012 without a national certification documenting the required education and experience.

1066.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1066.title: Tourism And Development
1066.description: Provides that for the fiscal year 2017 only, the distribution of hotel tax made to the various regional tourism districts be in amounts equal to the distributions made to such districts in fiscal year 2015.

1067.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1067.title: Rhode Island
1067.description: Requires the lottery to conduct an instant game known as the "Heritage Hall of Fame Lottery Game" with proceeds to go toward the construction of a Hall of Fame and Rhode Island History Center in Bristol.
