1068.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Prosys Finishing Technologies, Inc.
1068.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Prosys Finishing Technologies, Inc.

1071.title: Property Subject To Taxation - Burrillville
1071.description: Authorizes the town of Burrillville to extend its tax-stabilization program to cover mixed-use properties.

1074.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1074.title: Weapons - Stun-guns
1074.description: Permits the possession of a stun-gun under the same license conditions which apply to possession of a pistol.

1077.title: Mercury Reduction And Education Act
1077.description: Requires manufacturers of mercury-containing lamps to establish and implement a statewide collection for the recycling of mercury-containing lamps.

1080.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles-clean Diesel
1080.description: Establishes the Rhode Island clean diesel fund for the purpose of reducing emissions from heavy-duty diesel engines operating on state roads.

1082.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1082.title: New Shoreham Utility Association Act Of 2016
1082.description: Enables New Shoreham to present to voters the questions of creation of utility association and, if approved, its form as a district or cooperative to be called New Shoreham Utility Association.

1083.title: Relating To Motor And Other Vehicles-autocycles
1083.description: Creates a new type of vehicle, an autocycle, which shall be considered a motorcycle for all purposes except as specifically exempted.

1087.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1087.title: Interlocal Contracting And Joint Enterprises, And Regional Emergency Communication Districts
1087.description: Expands the ability of municipal and governmental units of this state to contract with governmental units of this or other states with respect to matters which they are authorized by law to perform.

1090.title: Simulcast Programs From Licensed Betting Facilities
1090.description: Authorizes holders of certain gaming licenses to simulcast programs for all or a portion of the days and times that video lottery games are offered at the licensee's facility.

1091.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1091.title: Relating To State Affairs And Government- Rhode Island Justice Commission
1091.description: Adds the president of the Rhode Island Brotherhood of Correctional Officers as a member of the criminal justice policy board.

1092.title: Address Confidentiality For Victims Of Domestic Violence
1092.description: Allows victims of domestic violence to have their addresses remain confidential unless the certification is withdrawn by the applicant or invalidated by the secretary of state.

1095.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1095.title: Relating To The Cumberland Fire District
1095.description: Establishes that membership on the Cumberland Fire District Fire Committee constitutes holding a public office and that the elections of the Fire Committee are governed by state election laws.

1096.title: Taxation Of Low-income Housing
1096.description: Enables municipalities to adopt ordinances exempting them from being required to accept any additional residential properties, otherwise eligible for alternative assessment and taxation, if said municipality has achieved certain housing goals.

1097.title: Adoption Of Children - Adoption Of Children - Termination Of Parental Rights
1097.description: Provides for the termination of the parental rights of a person who murders or commits manslaughter on the other parent of his or her child/children.

1098.title: Relief Of Injuries And Deceased Firefighters And Police
1098.description: Provides that firefighters who die as victims of homicide while still members, although not in the performance of active duty, be eligible for the same benefits as those killed on duty.

1099.title: Retirement Of Municipal Employees
1099.description: Makes certain technical and date-related revisions regarding the settlement agreement of municipal retirees in the city of Central Falls.

1104.title: Board Of Governors For Higher Education
1104.description: Includes armed college and university police officers of the state colleges among the class of individuals who are subject to control by the personnel administrator or by any officer or board other than the council on post-secondary education.

1105.title: Interstate Compact On Adoption Medical Assistance Act--department Of Children, Youth And Families
1105.description: Requires DCYF to promulgate rules and a plan to continue the adoption/subsidy for a special needs child upon the death of both adoptive parents or single parent for subsequent eligible foster parent(s) or adoptive parent(s).

1106.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Bear Hydraulics, Inc.
1106.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Bear Hydraulics, Inc.

1108.title: Rights Of Patients - Medical Record Fees For Veterans
1108.description: Requires health care providers to provide veterans copies of their medical records at no charge if the records are used to apply for benefits of any kind.

1109.title: Judicial Review Of Probate Court Orders And Decisions
1109.description: Removes the requirement for appellant of an order or decree of probate court to file request for certified copy of record of the procedures appealed from.

1110.title: Duties Of Utilities And Carriers -- Utility Base Rate
1110.description: Extends the Renewable Energy Development Fund (REF) program for ten years, from 2017 to 2027.

1112.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1112.title: Authorizing The Issuance Of Bonds, Refunding Bonds, And Temporary Notes Of The State Of Not More Than $10,000,000 Bonds And Notes Therefor In Support Of The State Bikeway Development Program
1112.description: Authorizes the state of Rhode Island to issue general obligation bonds in an amount not to exceed $10,000,000 for the state bikeway development program upon approval of a majority of the qualified electors voting on the proposition to issue these bonds.

1113.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1113.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment And Supplies
1113.description: Creates a trial program implementing the use of electronic poll books for elections.

1114.title: Wastewater Treatment Plants
1114.description: Requires a notice and opportunity to be heard by the public with regard to the permitting of wastewater treatment facilities.

1118.title: Barbers, Hairdressers, Cosmeticians, Manicurists, And Estheticians
1118.description: Permits licensed barbers, hairdressers, cosmeticians, manicurists, and estheticians to relocate to another hair design shop once during the term of their license without needing to obtain another license.

1122.title: Registration Of Vehicles--special Plate For Lupus Foundation New England
1122.description: Authorizes the issuance of a special license plate for Lupus Foundation New England.

1124.title: Property Assessed Clean Energy Program
1124.description: Provides that a PACE-related assessment shall, subject to the consent of existing mortgage holders, take precedence over all other liens except for liens for taxes.

1125.title: Time Of Opening Of Burrillville Polls
1125.description: Mandates that polls in the town of Burrillville open at 7 a.m. for all elective meetings.

1126.title: Personal Income Tax - Part 44-30-81 Procedure And Administration
1126.description: Provides that any 2015 tax overpayment would be refunded with interest calculated at twelve percent (12%) compounded daily if not received by June 30, 2016.

1130.last_action: Introduced, referred to House Municipal Government
1130.title: Taxation - Taxation Of Low-income Housing
1130.description: Exempts municipalities from being required to accept any additional residential properties, otherwise eligible for alternative assessment and taxation, if said municipality has achieved certain housing goals.

1132.title: In Amendment Of Chapter 974 Of The Public Laws, 1940, Entitled "to Incorporate The Stone Bridge Fire District And To Furnish A Supply Of Water For The Town Of Tiverton," As Amended
1132.description: Moves the annual meeting of the district from June to July, and conform the notice requirements to those prescribed by statute, requiring posting on the secretary of state's website.

1133.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Copyfax, Inc.
1133.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Copyfax, Inc.

1135.title: Renewable Energy Programs
1135.description: Establishes renewable energy polices to streamline the state's clean energy economy, allow virtual net metering, third party financing and a predictable tax process for commercial systems in host communities.

1138.title: Notaries Public And Justices Of The Peace
1138.description: Eliminates the requirement that a notary public be a resident of Rhode Island.

1139.title: Department Of Children, Youth, And Families
1139.description: Requires the DCYF to transition from child placement in group homes to child placement in foster care.

1140.title: House Resolution Congratulating Father Bernard Toal On The Occasion Of His 100th Birthday
1140.description: House Resolution Congratulating Father Bernard Toal On The Occasion Of His 100th Birthday

1141.description: House Resolution Reinstating And Extending The Commission Life And Amending The Membership Of The Special Legislative Commission To Study And Review Regulation Of Drones And Unmanned Aerial Vehicles

1142.description: House Resolution Expressing Condolences To The Barber Family On The Passing Of David Raymond Barber

1143.title: House Resolution Amending The Rules Of The House Of Representatives For The Years 2015-2016 (proposes An Amendment To The House Rules Which Would Establish A Standing Caucus To Be Known As The "freshman Caucus".)
1143.description: House Resolution Amending The Rules Of The House Of Representatives For The Years 2015-2016 (proposes An Amendment To The House Rules Which Would Establish A Standing Caucus To Be Known As The "freshman Caucus".)

1144.description: House Resolution Honoring Rhode Island Family Court Chief Judge Haiganush R. Bedrosian On Her Retirement After Thirty-five Years Of Distinguished And Devoted Service To Our State And The Citizens Of Rhode Island

1145.description: House Resolution Congratulating Archie R. Cole Middle School, East Greenwich, Rhode Island, For Being Named A 2015 Blue Ribbon School

1146.description: House Resolution Recognizing And Commending Robert G. Carlow, Jr., Upon Achieving Scouting's Most Distinguished Honor, The Rank Of Eagle Scout

1147.description: House Resolution Congratulating The Rhode Island Rivers Council On The Occasion Of Its 25th Anniversary

1150.title: House Resolution Recognizing The Fetus As A Human Life Upon The Existence Of A Heartbeat
1150.description: House Resolution Recognizing The Fetus As A Human Life Upon The Existence Of A Heartbeat

1151.title: House Resolution Creating A Special Legislative Commission To Study The Awarding, Implementation, And Management Practices Of All State Contracts (creates A Seven Member Commission To Study The Awarding, Implementation, And Management Of All State Contracts, And Who Reports Back No Later Than January 5, 2017, And Expires On March 5, 2017.)

1152.title: House Resolution Creating A Special Legislative Commission To Study And Review The Present And Future Use And Needs Of All Buildings Located In The Capitol Center District (creates A 10 Member Legislative Commission To Study The Present And Future Use And Needs Of Buildings Located In The Capitol Center District, And Who Reports Back To The House By April 13, 2017 And Expires On July 13, 2017.)
1152.description: House Resolution Creating A Special Legislative Commission To Study And Review The Present And Future Use And Needs Of All Buildings Located In The Capitol Center District (creates A 10 Member Legislative Commission To Study The Present And Future Use And Needs Of Buildings Located In The Capitol Center District, And Who Reports Back To The House By April 13, 2017 And Expires On July 13, 2017.)

1153.description: House Resolution Expressing Sincere Condolences On The Passing Of James Edward Gillen, Jr.

1154.description: House Resolution Honoring And Commending The Initiative And Actions Of The Multi-jurisdictional Task Force That Apprehended And Charged Numerous Individuals With Robbery And Breaking And Entering

1155.description: House Resolution Proclaiming 2016 To Be "the Year Of The Veteran" In The State Of Rhode Island

1156.title: House Resolution Creating A Special Legislative Commission To Study All Aspects Pertaining To The Management Of Infrastructure Programs In The State Of Rhode Island (creates A Nine Member Commission To Study Existing Infrastructure Programs In The State And Provide Recommendations For Improvements, And Report Back By April 30, 2017, And Expire On June 30, 2017.)

1157.description: House Resolution Proclaiming Wednesday, January 20th, 2016, As "#dstrong Day" In Honor Of Dorian Murray

1158.description: House Resolution Extending The Expiration Date Of The Special Legislative Commission To Study Methods For Growing Tourism In The State Of Rhode Island Through Coordinated Branding And Marketing Efforts

1159.title: House Resolution Congratulating The Warwick North Little League Softball All-stars For Their Outstanding 2015 Softball Season
1159.description: House Resolution Congratulating The Warwick North Little League Softball All-stars For Their Outstanding 2015 Softball Season

1160.title: House Resolution Congratulating Woonsocket Police Chief Thomas S. Carey On His Retirement After Thirty-three Years Of Faithful And Devoted Public Service In Law Enforcement

1375.title: Weather Related Losses
1375.description: Limits large windstorm damage deductibles and prohibits termination of policies solely due to major storm damage.

1378.title: Licensed Activities--lenders And Loan Brokers--check Cashing
1378.description: Separates the laws for "check cashing" and "payday lending".

1380.title: Distributed Generation Interconnection
1380.description: Amends provisions relative to renewable energy resources and interconnection standards and/or charges related thereto.

1386.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1386.title: Rhode Island Works Program - Compulsory Attendance
1386.description: Requires an eighty percent (80%) school attendance rate for children in families receiving cash and medical assistance from the state as a condition of eligibility. Parent/guardian would be required to attest to attendance rates.

1388.title: Compulsory Attendance
1388.description: Broadens the law on compulsory school attendance so that it would apply to all children enrolled in kindergarten.

1390.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture
1390.title: Outdoor Wood-fired Hydronic Heaters
1390.description: Regulates the sale and installation of outdoor wood-fired hydronic heaters.

1392.title: The Education And Equity And Property Tax Relief Act
1392.description: Eliminates provisions of §16-7-34.3 re: reimbursement by the state for conventional public housing students and adds language to §16-7.2-6 providing permanent foundation education aid funding for services for students residing in such housing.

1401.title: Liability And Computation
1401.description: Exempts the trade-in-value of pickup trucks weighing fourteen thousand pounds (14,000 lbs) or less from sales and use tax.

1404.title: Business Corporation Tax And Franchise Tax
1404.description: Repeals the minimum business tax for corporations including small business corporations having an election under subchapter S, 26 U.S.C. 1361

1408.title: Micro Zone Economic Revitalization Act
1408.description: Creates micro zones in distressed areas to stimulate economic revitalization, employment opportunities, and business development through the redevelopment of obsolete, dilapidated and abandoned industrial and commercial structures.

1409.title: Public Assistance
1409.description: Imposes a six (6) month waiting period for public assistance upon legally admitted aliens. Illegal or undocumented aliens would remain ineligible for public assistance.

1415.title: Distressed Areas Economic Revitalization Act
1415.description: Permits the Pontiac Mills site in Warwick to be approved as an enterprise zone.

1416.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1416.title: The Naturopathic Physicians Act Of 2016
1416.description: Establishes procedures for the licensing of naturopathic physicians, and defines the practice of naturopathic medicine. The practice of naturopathic medicine would be subject to oversight by the director of the Rhode Island department of health.

1428.title: Sexual Assault--statewide Accounting Of Sexual Assault Evidence Collection Kits--submission And Return Of Kits
1428.description: Requires law enforcement agencies to provide the attorney general a report identifying and describing any untested sexual assault evidence collection kits; requires laboratories to complete their testing of such kits within 180 days.

1431.title: Estate Tax
1431.description: Increases the value of all net taxable estates for the purpose of the estate and transfer tax from six hundred seventy-five thousand dollars ($675,000) to two million five hundred thousand dollars ($2,500,000).

1436.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1436.title: Governor And Lieutenant Governor
1436.description: Provides candidates for governor and lieutenant governor would run on a joint ticket.

1439.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1439.title: Veteran Courtesy Registration Plate
1439.description: Permits a courtesy plate to be issued on the "veteran" plate design.

1442.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1442.title: Courtesy Veterans' Plates
1442.description: Permits a veteran to request a "Courtesy Plate" with their choice of letters and numbers consistent with present availability with the veteran plate format.

1444.title: Produce Scales In Markets
1444.description: Requires sealers of weights and measures appointed by the cities and towns to receive the same fees as charged by state sealers who perform the same inspecting/testing services.

1449.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1449.title: Relating To Education – School And Youth Programs Concussion Act
1449.description: Refines the law on guidelines for concussions at school and youth programs so that an adult trained in recognizing the symptoms of a concussion is required to be present during events.

1450.title: Raw Milk
1450.description: Establishes procedures/standards issued by milk commission for handling/sale of raw milk with civil fines for violations.

1456.title: Compliance Of Health Benefit Contracts And Medical Assistance Program With Federal Law
1456.description: Provides that persons and small businesses purchasing coverage through the health benefit exchange shall have the option of purchasing at least one plan that excludes coverage for induced abortions.

1457.title: Pet Grooming And Pet Retail Establishments - Sprinklers
1457.description: Requires sprinklers within pet grooming and retail pet sales stores.

1459.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1459.title: Rights Of Nursing Home Patients
1459.description: Enables nursing home residents whose rights are violated to bring an action against the facility for actual and punitive damages. Any plaintiff who prevails shall be entitled to recover attorneys' fees and costs of the action.

1461.title: Trespass And Vandalism
1461.description: Requires a property owner to maintain trees or shrubs that create a nuisance to an abutting property owner.

1463.title: Residential Landlord And Tenant Act
1463.description: Sets forth a process for tenants to retrieve their abandoned personal property from former dwelling units and the placement in storage of a tenant's personal property.

1466.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1466.title: Electronic Marijuana-delivery Systems
1466.description: Defines and regulates the use of electronic marijuana delivery system products.

1468.title: Stopping, Standing, And Parking Restrictions
1468.description: Makes stopping, standing or parking a vehicle at any place where official signs prohibit parking subject to a fine of eighty-five dollars ($85.00).

1472.last_action: Senate voted to recommit to Senate Judiciary
1472.title: Ethics - Education
1472.description: Requires all state senators and senate employees to annually participate in at least one of the Ethics Commission educational programs provided by the State Ethics Commission.

1482.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1482.title: Professional Employer Organizations Act Of 2004
1482.description: Amends certain definitions relative to workers compensation and classifications of temporary and leased employees and amends certain benefits thereto.

1484.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1484.title: Plumbers And Irrigators
1484.description: Requires master and journeyperson plumbers to complete a course of continuing education prior to the renewal or reinstatement of their license as determined by the board of examiners.

1487.title: Firefighter Registration Plates
1487.description: Makes firefighters plates available to active and retired firefighters who are otherwise eligible for combination registration plates.

1494.title: Estate And Transfer Taxes -- Liability And Computation
1494.description: Provides for an increase in the marital estate deduction in certain instances.

1496.title: Income Tax Refunds - State Tax Officials
1496.description: Gives all state income tax return filers the option to have their tax refund directly deposited into their bank account.

1499.title: Establishing A Program Within The Department Of Human Services To Provide For Emergency Housing Assistance
1499.description: Establishes an emergency housing assistance fund to be administered by the department of human services in conjunction with community action program agencies.

1504.title: Relating To Taxation-sales And Use Taxes-personal Income Tax
1504.description: Subtracts state tax refunds, paid to an individual in the previous year, from federal adjusted gross income, for purposes of the state income tax.

1508.title: Health Care For Families
1508.description: Expands the income disregards or other methodology for parents or relative caretakers eligible for medical assistance.

1516.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1516.title: Capital City Underground Utility Initiative
1516.description: Authorizes the Energy Facility Siting Board to establish an enforceable schedule for the completion of the Capital City Underground Utility Initiative on or before July 30, 2017.

1518.title: Minority Business Enterprise
1518.description: Provides that any minority business enterprise that is certified by the Small Business Act shall be deemed certified by the department of administration as a minority business enterprise.

1519.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1519.title: Excavation Near Underground Utility Facilities -- Costs

1533.description: Authorizes a lease agreement between the town of Coventry and the water resources board for a portion of the Big River reservoir property to be used as a compost facility.

1534.description: Permits fishing in trout waters at any time of year without seasonal restriction.

1537.title: Pension Profit Sharing Or Annuity Plans
1537.description: Provides protection to retirees whose pension plans are divested of ERISA protections as a result of the sale of a group annuity by an insurance company.

1540.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1540.title: Renewable Energy Tax Credit
1540.description: Provides for a residential renewable energy systems tax credit.

1547.title: Correctional Healthcare Act
1547.description: Establishes procedures that would reduce the state's correctional inmate healthcare costs.

1548.title: Correctional Institutions
1548.description: Reduces inmate healthcare costs by billing Medicaid for eligible inpatient hospital and professional services.

1552.title: Sales And Use Taxes - Enforcement And Collection
1552.description: Enacts 10 year statute of limitations on assessment of/commitment of any collection action for any tax due and payable pertaining to RI sales/use tax/estate tax/personal income tax/business corporation tax effective 7/1/16.

1556.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1556.description: Requires nonprofit dental service plan providers to provide notice of any changes relating to coverage to all plan purchasers purchasing dental services for employees under a group or individual policy contract or health benefit plan.

1565.description: Requires parole board members be appointed by the governor with the advice and consent of the senate.

1577.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1577.title: Aerial Privacy Protection Act
1577.description: Prohibits law enforcement from using unmanned aerial vehicles without a proper warrant.

1581.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1581.title: Workers' Compensation Benefits
1581.description: Repeals the provision of the general laws relating to continuation of workers' compensation benefits for partial incapacity.

1584.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1584.title: Relating To Holidays And Days Of Special Observance-work On Holidays And Sundays
1584.description: Repeals §25-3-7 of the general laws which gives the director of the department of labor and training the authority to exempt certain classes of employees form receiving overtime pay for Sunday and holiday work.

1587.title: Registration Of Vehicles -- Special Plate In Honor Of Cesar E. Chavez
1587.description: Creates a special registration plate to honor César E. Chávez.

1592.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1592.title: Size, Weight, And Load Limits
1592.description: Sets new weight restrictions on vehicles traveling over the Ten Mile River Bridge in Pawtucket.

1594.title: Automated School Zone Speed Enforcement System
1594.description: Authorizes department of transportation and municipalities to operate automated school zone speed enforcement systems.

1600.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1602.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1603.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1603.title: Cardiac Arrest Prevention In School Sports
1603.description: Raises awareness of the potential for sudden cardiac arrest among student athletes.

1607.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1607.title: Property Subject To Taxation -- Renewable Energy Systems
1607.description: Clarifies that the exemption from taxes of any renewable energy system is to the real estate of such system.

1609.description: Repeals the five hundred dollar ($500) minimum tax on corporations, limited liability companies and limited partnerships.

1615.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1615.title: Retirement System -- Contributions And Benefits

1616.description: Expands the number of municipal economic zones permitted by law to areas located in a municipality designated as a state-approved "growth center".

1617.description: Requires reimbursement payments from the general fund to volunteer fire departments responding to emergencies on or along Route 95.

1618.title: Relating To The Uniformed Controlled Substances Act
1618.description: Approval and funding of drug awareness programs for minors placed with the department of behavioral healthcare, developmental disabilities and hospitals.

1621.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1621.title: Department Of Environmental Management - User Fees
1621.description: Increases the percentage of state beach fees payable to the city or town where the facility is located from sixteen percent (16%) to twenty percent (20%).

1628.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1628.title: Fire Districts Located In Coventry
1628.description: Limits each of the Coventry Fire Districts tax levy increases to the consumer price index, but not to exceed five percent (5%) in any one year

1630.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1630.description: Restricts the department of health's authority to impose and/or change the current mandated vaccinations.

1633.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1633.title: Department Of Health--immunizations
1633.description: Restricts the authority of the department of health to set minimum immunization standards for diseases not transmitted in a school environment.

1641.title: Solemnization Of Marriages
1641.description: Allows governor to designate a person to solemnize a particular marriage.

1642.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1642.title: Electronic Voting
1642.description: Requires General Assembly votes to be reported electronically within 30 minutes of the vote being cast.

1645.title: State Affairs And Government
1645.description: Requires persons in government custody use actual residence for census and redistricting purposes as determined by department of corrections and secretary of state.

1646.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1646.title: Registration Of Voters
1646.description: Changes the period of time a voter may have to change their party affiliation from the 90th day preceding any primary election for which the voter is eligible to the 29th day preceding any primary election for which the voter is eligible.

1648.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1648.title: District Court
1648.description: Permits retired district court clerk/magistrates or magistrates to be recalled after retirement.

1649.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1649.title: Litigation Lending Agreements
1649.description: Makes litigation loan agreements subject to state usury statutes.

1656.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1656.title: Immigration Status
1656.description: Prohibits landlords from inquiring about immigration status of a tenant, prospective tenant, occupant, or prospective occupant of residential rental property.

1659.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1659.title: Rhode Island Veterans' Memorial Cemetery
1659.description: Requires dogs to be leashed on cemetery property and owners of the dog to clean up upon completion of the visit. Any violation would be punishable by a fine of ten dollars ($10.00).

1660.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1660.description: Requires (14) days advance notification of blasting by registered mail to abutters, owners or owners of record of any improved property within 500 feet from property line of blast site, including road/bridge/utility/public works construction.

1665.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1665.title: The Permanent Joint Committee On Naming All New Buildings, Bridges, Edifices, And Other State Constructions
1665.description: Renames the bridge in the city of Providence known as the I-195 Providence River Bridge: No. 1181 to the William D. Warner Memorial Bridge.

1675.description: Allows municipalities to award bids for contracts in an amount less than $500,000 to a business located within its municipality if it is current on all taxes, its bid is within 10% of the lowest bid and it is willing to match the lowest bid.

1676.description: Extends the right to property tax relief to any veteran honorably discharged by eliminating references to particular conflicts.

1682.title: Renewable Energy Standard
1682.description: Authorizes 10 yr solar incentive program run by energy resources & funds by $100,000 annual allocation from development fund for installing new solar energy system of 10 kw or less at owner's residence on/after 7/1/16 resulting in $500 payment.

1683.title: Tax Increment Financing
1683.description: Repeals the tax increment financing act.

1685.title: Sales And Use Tax - Liability And Computation
1685.description: Adds honorably discharged disabled veterans who purchase a new motor vehicle to the category of certain veterans exempt from sales and use taxes.

1686.title: Rehabilitation Loans
1686.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws which authorize cities, towns, and redevelopment agencies to make rehabilitation loans.

1687.title: Insurance--mental Illness And Substance Abuse -- The Alexander Perry And Brandon Goldner Act
1687.description: Requires comprehensive discharge planning for patients treated for substance use disorders, opioid overdoses and chronic addiction and would require insurers to cover expanded medication-assisted addiction treatment.

1688.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1688.title: Housing Project Loans
1688.description: Repeals the provisions of the general laws which authorized housing authorities and redevelopment agencies to loan money for constructing low income housing.

1707.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1707.description: Establishes a cause of action against employers and employees for workplace bullying, harassment and other abusive conduct that is tolerated by employers.

1717.description: Adds a performance-based component to the state funding formulas for CCRI, RIC and URI.

1722.title: The Bright Today Scholarship And Open Enrollment Education Act
1722.description: Provides parents of K-12 students with opportunity to enroll their child in an educational program of their choosing with designated public monies to follow the student to school selected by parent.

1723.description: Renames the Rhode Island storage tank financial responsibility review board to the Rhode Island storage tank financial responsibility advisory board and would claim process and oversight of the underground storage tank fund.

1728.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1728.title: Attorney's Fees
1728.description: Attorney fees may be awarded to a prevailing defendant in a breach of contract action.

1732.description: Limits tortfeasor liability to several only if defendant’s act or omission constituted no more than (25% of the plaintiff's damages.

1733.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1733.title: Eminent Domain
1733.description: Prohibits the use of eminent domain powers for economic development purposes.

1735.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1741.description: Amends the charters of the Coventry Fire District and Central Coventry Fire District to provide that no vote at a meeting of either the district would have effect unless at the time of the vote not less than 2% of those eligible are present and voting.

1746.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1755.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1755.description: Eliminates the sales tax on taxi services.

1756.description: Authorizes an exemption to tangible business or personal property in whole or in part within the town of Charlestown subject to authorization of the Charlestown town council.

1757.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1764.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1793.description: Authorize a vote to amend the composition of the Chariho Regional School District's school committee.

1794.description: Extends full pay and benefits coverage for corrections personnel to injuries suffered during off duty emergencies and travel.

1806.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1820.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1839.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1844.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1851.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1895.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1904.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Stephen P. Osella Plumbing, Ltd.
1904.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Stephen P. Osella Plumbing, Ltd.

1919.last_action: Referred to House Environment and Natural Resources

1919.description: Amends the definition of "recycling" and "recyclable materials" in several chapters of the general laws.

1940.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1945.description: Permits the hiring of government workers to act as poll workers for primary elections.

1948.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
1948.title: Department Of Environmental Management -- Dock Safety

1966.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1966.description: Prohibits electric distribution companies from requiring security deposits from commercial customers who have maintained accounts for more than one year.

1975.description: Makes the director and other positions of the state crime laboratory employees of the council on postsecondary education as opposed to limited appointments positions of the board of governors.

1977.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1979.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

1981.last_action: Senate voted to recommit to Senate Environment & Agriculture

1981.description: Requires livestock dealers to follow standards adopted by the livestock welfare and care standards advisory council.

1985.description: Allows the director of DEM to waive registration fees and surcharges upon a finding of limited, special, local need for the product.

2000.description: Allows students who are diagnosed with substance use disorder or dependency to be referred to a Rhode Island recovery high school by a licensed clinician funded by at least $500,000 per year subject to state appropriations.

2004.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2007.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Special Legislation and Veterans Affairs

2011.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2011.description: Requires that legally appointed guardians, whether temporary or permanent, file a durable power of attorney for health care and/or a living will on behalf of their ward within 30 days.

2024.title: Office Of State Medical Examiners--department Of Children, Youth And Families And The Office Of The Child Advocate -- Child Fatality Reporting

2039.title: Creating Enabling Legislation To Allow City Of Cranston Employees Who Are Members Of Local 1363, International Association Of Fire Fighters, Afl-cio To Be Exempt From The Rhode Island Municipal Employees' Retirement System
2039.description: Provides that certain Cranston firefighters in Local 1363 would be exempt from the municipal employee's retirement system and would allow the city of Cranston to consider all such employees for a city-sponsored defined contribution plan.

2042.description: Allows the city of Cranston to allow Colonel Michael Winquist to participate in the city of Cranston's 401(k) retirement plan in lieu of the Rhode Island Municipal Employees' Retirement System.

2044.description: Authorizes the state investment commission to create an "Emerging Manager Program" to promote investment with newer, smaller and more diverse asset managers.

2047.title: Interest Rates
2047.description: Reduces the interest rate on delinquent tax payments to between 4% and 7%.

2060.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2060.description: Establishes the office of administrative hearings to adjudicate contested state agency cases.

2074.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2074.title: Health Insurance Coverage
2074.description: Amends the laws governing Rhode Island health insurance coverage to bring them into compliance with federal laws, with emphasis on compliance with The Patient Protection and Affordable Care Act (P.L. 111-148).

2089.last_action: Introduced, referred to Senate Environment and Agriculture

2089.description: Requires the director of the department of environmental management to promulgate and adopt rules and regulations pertaining to the use of pesticide products containing neonicotinoids.

2103.title: Long-term Economic Development
2103.description: Requires a long-term economic policy/strategic implementation plan to receive a public hearing by house/senate, but also a vote of approval with transmittal to the governor for signature before it takes effect.

2115.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2117.title: Health Insurance Oversight
2117.description: Empowers the health insurance commissioner to establish payor guidelines to develop and maintain a system allowing patients electronic access to their health claims information pursuant to federal regulations by 7/1/17.

2123.title: Conduct Of Election And Voting Equipment, And Supplies

2126.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2126.description: Enables the violating authority to inform the attorney general whenever any person who has been placed on a filing violates the terms and conditions of the probation.

2144.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Silver Lake Pizza, Inc.
2144.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Silver Lake Pizza, Inc.

2145.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Atlantic Cigar Co. L.l.c.
2145.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Atlantic Cigar Co. L.l.c.

2150.title: Public Preparatory Academies

2152.title: Reinstatement Fees For The Reinstatement Of Operating Privileges And Registration Rights
2152.description: Conforms the amount of the fees for the reinstatement of operating privileges and registration rights suspended under this section to the amount of the fees for the reinstatement after suspension pursuant to other sections of title 31.

2166.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2202.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2213.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study

2213.description: Provides that applicants for historic tax credits shall have ninety (90) days after the date of the commission's written determination certifying the rehabilitation to pay the required three percent (3%) non-refundable fee to the division of taxation.

2222.title: Relating To Criminal Offenses-assaults
2222.description: Make an assault or battery upon a dwarf resulting in bodily injury a felony and would be punishable by up to three (3) years imprisonment and an assault resulting in serious bodily injury punishable by to twenty (20) years imprisonment.

2223.title: Relating To Food And Drugs-the Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act Of 2016
2223.description: Creates "The Good Samaritan Overdose Prevention Act of 2016" which would exempt from liability any person who administers an opioid antagonist to another person to prevent a drug overdose.

2225.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Burrillville Cesspool Cleaning, Inc.
2225.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Burrillville Cesspool Cleaning, Inc.

2229.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2229.title: Meal And Beverage Tax
2229.description: Authorizes Newport and Middletown to collect an additional one percent meal and beverage tax to fund road and sewer repairs.

2238.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2238.title: The Towing Storage Act
2238.description: Requires that motor vehicles lawfully seized by police officers for investigation or for lack of registration not be released to their owners until the towing charges are paid or valid registration certificates are produced.

2245.title: Utilization Review
2245.description: Requires transparency in the criteria used by utilization review agents.

2249.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Green Realty Associates, Llc.
2249.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Green Realty Associates, Llc.

2250.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Surgi-care, Inc.
2250.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Surgi-care, Inc.

2253.title: Collection Of Taxes Generally
2253.description: Provides that taxes assessed for mobile or manufactured homes in the town of Richmond would constitute a lien on the mobile or manufactured home.

2260.title: Relating To The Town Of New Shoreham
2260.description: Allows electors in the town of New Shoreham to authorize the creation of a new utility district or cooperative.

2265.title: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Concurrent Computer Corporation
2265.description: To Vacate The Forfeiture Or Revocation Of The Charter Of Concurrent Computer Corporation

2266.last_action: Committee recommended measure be held for further study
2266.title: Relating To Capital Development Program
2266.description: Provides for a bond referendum which would authorize the issuance of bonds, refunding bonds, and temporary notes of the state in the aggregate amount of twenty million dollars ($20,000,000).

2268.title: Delivered Fuels Energy Efficiency Program
2268.description: Creates the delivered fuels energy efficiency program, the purpose of which would be to facilitate and promote energy efficiency services for Rhode Island residents, businesses, and customers who rely on delivered fuels.

2272.title: Collection And Management Of Decedent's Estates
2272.description: Transfer jurisdiction over estate investments from the superior court to the probate court.

2276.title: Clean Diesel
2276.description: Establishes the Rhode Island clean diesel fund for the purpose of reducing emissions from heavy-duty diesel engines operating on state roads.
